There are abundant restaurant choices within 1-2 blocks. This is truly a great value. You can spend a lot more and not get a lot more and maybe less. Oh by the way, breakfast is good, always replenished, but busy and crowded. Not sure best time to go probably early.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Good clean Hotel 15 mins walk to Times SqClean RoomsFriendly StaffFree Tea Coffee Free BreakfastManager Left Bottle wine and Chocs in Our room for our Anniversary :-) Would recommend to anyone and wouldnt hesitate to Book Room again next time in New York

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I can't fault this hotel at all! The staff go out of their way to help you. The rooms are spotless , with fresh towels and the room cleaned daily.The breakfast is amazing , self serve style , with staff constantly refilling and topping up . I would advice you to get into the breakfast room really early or later on because it does get really busy. We ate outside one or two times in the sunshine , which was was nice. The hotel is situated in a residential area and so you get a real feel for New York and with only a ten minute walk to Times Square gives you the opportunity to walk off your substantial breakfast.
user_name:
Gaynor B
Manchester, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed a couple of nights at this property in the spring. It was affordable and seemed like a good choice for our visit.I have many positive things to say about the hotel. The staff were very friendly. We were checked in quickly and efficiently with smiles. The real standout in friendliness was the breakfast staff who were constantly asking if we were doing OK and how our morning was. Breakfast itself was incredibly plentiful and filling with good hot and cold options to choose from.Our room was small, which was to be expected after many New York visits. I wouldn't want to spend a lot of time in the small room but it was efficiently laid out. The king bed took up most of the space but there was still room for bed side tables and a desk/closet. The bathroom was fairly cramped but still very useable. We had a nice blackout blind and well working heating/AC controls.The one negative aspect I have to say about the hotel is its location. While we recognized it was on the west side, the long three avenue walk from Times Square felt especially tiresome at night with no good subway service. We appreciated the bars around the corner (and their good happy hour) but 11th Avenue is about one avenue too far for our comfort and timeliness. I'd probably stay somewhere a little bit closer next time.Location/distance aside, this is a very comfortable property. I'm not sure how old it is but it seemed quite well kept, almost new, and we enjoyed the free breakfast and the friendly staff and compact but comfortable room.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I travel frequently to New York, but usually stay closer to Union Square because one of my children is a student at NYU. We chose this Holiday Inn for a combination of price and location -- we had tickets for Broadway. It was further west than I realized . . . but that wouldn't have been a real problem because we like to walk. The real reason for my lackluster rating is that this hotel does a HUGE business with tour groups. Busloads of people and their luggage were an almost constant fixture in the hotel lobby. It was difficult to walk in a straight line from the hotel entrance to the registration desk. We frequently had long waits at the elevator. I didn't try to get breakfast, but my friend talked about how challenging it was to navigate the crowds and get to the food . . .The room at the hotel was very small, but it was clean and well furnished. The bathroom faucet was missing a part that would have made the water flow in a more controlled pattern . . . not a big deal . . . just another shortfall.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Staff was very helpful and friendly. Coffee and free food weren't great but it was free so you can't ask too much. Rooms could use a bit more sound proofing. Quite small and rather expensive but those prices are normal for NY. Our shower had cracking tiles and the cover for the bolts on the handrail had fallen off so it could use some attention. The included wifi worked well.Parking is around the corner and not unaffordable but our car got scratched while parked there.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I have just returned from a four night stay, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the shower room was nicely fitted out, but most of all we were at the back of the hotel so there was no noise, from everything I'd heard of NY I was expecting no space and no quiet.... We had plenty of both. The breakfast is as you would expect, plenty of it, refreshed regularly, buffet style, but an adequate mix of dishes on offer for a quick bite to start the day. It's not in the thick of things in the city but it's not far (10 min walk) to the subway or Times Square.We found the staff very helpful every time we approached them for help, directions, recommendations etc.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My favorite part about this hotel was definitely the employees! I'm giving them 5 stars! They were exceptionally kind and helpful. Pierre, John, Farrel, Juan and Melvin... you all rock! I'll be staying there again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We had a great visit to NYC and thought this Holiday Inn Express was great. The room room was quiet and the beds were comfortable (two most important criteria for me). Staff was very friendly and breakfast was typical for Holiday Inn Express.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I couldn't believe how accommodating and well trained the staff was! I'm from way out of town and they treated me as if we were cousins! I loved it! These people are a true asset! The room was nice a big and the bed was so comfy!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Yes, rooms are super tiny, but who cares when u just need a place to sleep while out galavanting in the Big Apple? What makes this otherwise ordinary Holiday Inn Express extraordinary, is the amazing staff. From the folks at the front desk, to the hard workers trying to keep the breakfast bar stocked, to anyone I ran into in the halls or elevators, without exception, were genuinely the friendliest, most helpful & kind people I've ever encountered in my travels! It was kind of weird. I kept expecting the spell to be broken by someone losing their cool during one of the crazy packed breakfasts where they just couldn't keep up and there was standing room only in the lounge area, but nope, it never happened. My husband spent a whole day of vacation in bed due to being ill during the night & hadn't eaten anything all day so I asked if there was any chance they had an apple left over from breakfast at 9pm...not only did the awesome staff member give me 2 apples to take to my hubs, but also a banana & orange! Really, I just had the warm fuzzies the whole time I was there & never felt stupid asking for help or questions as a 1st time visitor to the Big City! Plus-hust around the corner from Hell's Kitchen-where we ate most of the time which I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We had a great time in New York at this really nice hotel. Room was clean, they offered free breakfast that was surprisingly similar to European type of breakfast and a free Wi-Fi, we could connect up to 6 devices without any issues. Hotel is located in a quite neighborhood and is within walking distance to Times square. The staff was nice and friendly. I would definitely recommend it to everyone.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: In busy Manhattan you have grown to expect luke-warm but efficient hospitality. The staff at this Property are all a breath of fresh air. It all starts on the top and the manager (I think her name was Yan) is so warm and accomodating that you feel the small town friendliness. We checked our luggage when we arrived early and we had to chase the person that brought our luggage back to us to give him a tip. Nobody has their hand out! Her partner at the front desk doubles as a breakfast host and is fun and remembers your name. This place is busy busy but they have a way of making you feel important. I stay at HI Express a lot and the breakfast here was always fresh. The maid on my floor (7) was friendly and helpful. A different feel than at most Manhattan hotels! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I have travelled to New York City five times in the past several months and have stayed at a different hotel each time including a small boutique hotel and a fancy 4-star hotel that had a special rate. I have to say that Holiday Inn Express West Side was my favorite! The staff is warm and friendly and gave my partner and I an incredibly friendly greeting upon arrival. We were checked in immediately even though we were a couple of hours early. The room itself was lovely and the bed was supremely comfortable. The location is great, near tons of restaurants on Restaurant Row in Hells Kitchen. I keep an eye on special rates and offers for Holiday Inn Express and plan to stay there during my next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Had a really great visit at this property and chose it originally, for the great rate. Got a free breakfast and it within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park - just far enough off the beaten path to be a bit sheltered from some of the hustle and bustle of the city. The staff were outstanding and while the hotel was very full - did not let that craziness negatively impact the service they provided. The rooms are clean and current and the hotel in general was in good shape. Recommend this spot for families or travelers on a tight budget - great hotel brand and a good hotel for everyone to enjoy.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: First of all, I hardly ever review things, but this time felt I needed to say something. My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, and were blown away by the staff at this hotel, especially the gentlemen handling the breakfast duties. They took the time to greet us with a smile and a few kind words EVERY morning, while they cleaned the tables and handled the morning rush of people. The food was hot, fresh and plentiful. My wife LOVED the pancake machine, and I enjoyed the warm cinnamon rolls. The rooms were small but not cramped, and had everything we needed. The internet access and WiFi was excellent, as good as being at home. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the subway station, which on cold/rainy/snowy days can be bothersome, but still pleasant. Overall, this was an exceptional value of staying close enough to the action, while still having a nice quiet rest at night.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Had a lovely stay in this hotel last week - upgraded to free breakfast on arrival - it was delightful. The staff were all friendly and informative - couldn't have asked for more. Only 10mins walk from Times Square, very handy in the City that never sleeps.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed at the holiday inn express for 6 days, and had a wonderful stay. The hotel seemed really full, but all the staff were wonderfull. Especially during breakfast rush, the staff did not seem to be swamped, always had a smile on their faces. The room was very confortable and the location was amazing near enough to the subway, Times Square and lots of choices of restaurants nearby. Definitely would recommend and on my next trip to NY would like to come back to this property.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: A clean, affordable hotel in a slightly out-of-the way location. Staff are very friendly & helpful.Rooms are clean but incredibly small/cramped with little storage...not a big issue if your stay is only for 1 or 2 nights, but a pain if longer. Breakfast is good quality, but does not vary from day to day. Serving area has limited seating and stays packed; you'll see many who are forced to take food back to room. Elevators are incredibly slow.Final note: new construction underway across the street, so don't plan on a quiet stay anytime soon...but then again it's NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: we booked a room at this hotel when we were forced to leave our previous accommodation. The hotel is a bit outside of the main tourist drag but a ten minute walk will take you to all main transit systems and the busy mid townThe rooms are small but very comfortable and clean with a comfortable bed and everything else that is needed.The breakfast is amazing with a wonderful variety of items both hot and cold - good quality and always being refilled. During the day there is always fresh and good coffee, Break Fast IS A REAL TREAT, even though dinning area is a bit cramped and busythe staff is amazing. always have a smile on their faces always helpful. courteous and with a real desire to give high quality serve. The best of hotels can come to learn how to treat a guestthe hotel has good internet and has a small but good fitness center which is ope 24/7 and I used it a lot.Highly recommend

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed for a night. Great staff, great room and great hotel to Get In-Sleep-Get Out for a great day. A couple blocks aways from the nearest train station (Just saying, for people that don't like to walk often and for the kind of weather of February). Excellent FREE breakfast!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Expess for a few days and enjoyed everything about it. The staff was very professional and informative regarding any question I posed. My 2dbl room suited me and my mother just fine. The room had everything we needed. Breakfast was busy however well worth it. To top it all off Joshua one of the breakfast attendees was very warm,funny and even made sure I got my 12:30 late checkout!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This is a nice, functional, little hotel with all one would need. Found it through Hotwire - so the price was very good for NYC, even though we weren't sure what to expect.The two main positives and even surprises were 1. the staff who were exceptionally friendly and helpful and 2. The very generous and varied breakfast that is included in the price of the room The two main disadvantages of the hotel were: 1. It is slightly out of the way - near to 11th ave - on an unattractive street. A 10/15 min walk to the nearest subway station and you have to walk up to 9th and 8th ave to find nice places to eat and shop 2, The room is small - and nowhere convenient to place luggage. So for 2 people, each with a large suitcase and maybe a trolley - there's a lot of climbing over things!Overall we had a good experience, and might use this hotel again

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel was a bargain - we stayed for 6 nights and found the location to be really good, just a short walk (about 3 blocks) to the middle of Times Square and the nearest subway. The breakfast is free for everyone and was pretty good with a some hot choices and a good selection of bagels/yogurts/toast/pancakes etc. The wifi was great and we found the staff to be really helpful whenever we needed them - helped us book our transfers and let us leave our suitcases in the hotel for the day after checkout. Would definitely stay again in the future!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I was quite surprised when I went to the IHG/ holiday inn we site and found this property for $96! Breakfast included. Now I arrived the Wednesday before The busy Valentines/ Presidents' Day weekend, and the rates shot up on Friday the 14th (as they did everywhere in NYC). The hotel is a bit far west, between 10th and 11th, but there are plenty of bars and restaurants and other cool places on 9th. The staff was great, helping me secure a package arriving from Asia. I will return!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed in February 2015. The hotel is in a fairly safe-appearing area which may be a little out of the way for some. There isn't too much close by except small ethnic food shops, some which are really good. Times Square is a walkable distance away, as is a subway station. You WILL have to walk!The room was pretty small, borderline cramped but overall comfortable. Stayed on the 11th story and noise was not an issue aside from the occasional siren. The complimentary breakfast was very good with pastries, eggs/waffles/pancakes, fruit, yogurt, bread, the usual. Staff was very friendly and extremely accommodating!Try walking the riverfront which is nearby and makes for some pretty sights. The pier which houses Circle Line tour ships is very close by.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: When I was checking in at night I was greeted by no one at the front desk. I waited 15 minutes until someone finally came to the front desk. The front desk agent did not even acknowledge our presence clearly seeing us standing in front of him. We waited 10 more minutes and we had to acknowledge him ourselves, he replied with "one minute." 5 minutes later he then said you guys are ready and here is your key, your room number and the WiFi password. I was surprised because he didn't ask any questions nor did he ask for an ID. We thought possibly since we were the only one there to check in that he assumed who we were. When we got to the 3rd floor room 313 we tried opening the door and it did not work then we realized that someone already occupied this room because someone responded saying, " you have the wrong room." We had to go back to front desk because clearly this front desk agent was incompetent and is clearly not doing his job. I told him what happened and to please get our name and information this time so we can get the right room. So when he took our information he came to the conclusion that we weren't booked for that time, and it was for a later time in the day, so he said he can't do anything that we would have to book another night there in order to stay that night. So I get upset because instead of trying to accommodate us and fixing the situation he was just trying to brush us off, so I ended up having to call hotwire.com for the mistake myself and fix it myself. Hotwire ended up having to speak to the same front desk agent to confirm the matter so I don't see why he couldn't have called them himself, so instead the representative from Hotwire had to fix the issue for me and we were able to stay the night. When the front desk agent gave us the key he didn't even tell us what time was breakfast or what time we check out. This service agent Pedro was very unprofessional in all forms, his tie was undone, had a very uninterested attitude. As well he basically caused a security issue, when not asking for ID before giving us a room key, and sending us up to a room that was already occupied. It seems that anyone can just walk in there get a key without paying and if they try there luck they might have a free room. This agent was the exact opposite of hospitality this will definitely make me not want to go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: First the Pros - Staff was very polite and friendly. Hats off to Richard at the front desk from my hometown! Breakfast was included and was pretty good - eggs, sausage or bacon, breads, yogurt, fresh fruit and I loved the machine that made pancakes to order. Con was breakfast room was always crowded and hard to find a place to sit. The rooms were clean. Location was good. Rooms have nice flat screen TVs with great HD picture. I thought the location was pretty good and we walked to most places. Also wifi is free.Cons - Rooms are tiny, and I mean teeny tiny. The bed takes up most of the room so you can barely walk around. The bathroom is the smallest I've ever seen in my life of traveling, except for the bathrooms on cruise ships. Our air conditioner was so noisy when it was trying to maintain temperature that we could not sleep at night and the loud construction from across the street woke us up at 6am each morning. Elevators are tiny and take forever to arrive. Gym is also too small without that much equipment. The room we rented for the kids did not have toilet paper (they used the Kleenex in the room, the maid did not replace it so I had to go to the front desk on day 2 to have them bring toilet paper. Lastly, I am not from New York, so in my opinion, room is expensive for size and quality - not luxurious at all). Hotel does not have parking and the parking is very expensive. There is also no where on the street to unload without blocking traffic as the hotel does not have a driveway.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff was very accommodating and also had hi touch service. Location is great - short walk to times square and also easy parking options that validate near by. Also the breakfast there is always very appreciated in the mornings to get a quick start before heading out to the local attractions.Thanks again for a great stay.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I recently stayed at the Manhattan West HIExpress for three nights with my boyfriend, and we had a great stay. The staff is very friendly and efficient, from the front desk to the breakfast area staff, and cleaning staff. This is a very budget friendly hotel for a visit to NYC! Our room was ready upon our very early arrival (11:30 am) and we were so grateful that we could get settled in. There was a water main break on 48th Street which affected the water supply for the entire block for about 12 hours. Luckily most of those hours were while we were sleeping, but the front desk supplied bottled water, and breakfast went on unaffected the next morning. The free breakfast is adequate - the coffee is plentiful and good, and food offered includes cereal, instant oatmeal, warm cinnamon rolls, scrambled eggs, bacon and/or sausage, yogurt, toast, bagels, apples, oranges, bananas, hard boiled eggs, and best of all, a cool pancake machine. Press the button and two warm, fresh pancakes come out the other end. This was always a popular part of the breakfast bar when we went down for breakfast. USA Today newspapers were available, too. Our corner 11th floor room was quiet and comfortable, with good natural light and a city view. We enjoyed running along the Hudson River walking/biking path located a few blocks west, and we especially enjoyed the Highline Trail which begins 10 blocks south, by the Javits Center. The mild January weather certainly helped! We walked to a different restaurant each night, either to the south or east. Becco on W. 46th (Restaurant Row) is our favorite! We would definitely stay here again when we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed for 4 nights and by check out time, I did not want t leave. The staff is so helpful, accommodating, friendly, and just gives overall great customer service. The room was enough space for two people and very quiet if you request to be on the high floor. The only noise that may be a bit disturbing is housekeeping that comes around every morning but other than that, I would recommend everyone go. I will be returning for sure. The location is secluded and not right in the middle of the noise and chaos, there is free breakfast in the morning, cable tv, you can control the thermostat in the room so it was so warm and comfy, clean towels every day and our bed was nicely tucked! Thank you for the wonderful service.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We had one night in NYC, this was pretty good value and location. It wasn't the best block, but the room was very nice, modern and clean, overlooking some skyline, mainly apt. buildings. Tenth Avenue was right up the street if you needed to hail a cab. If You have a car you can over nite park it around the block, and hotel will stamp your card for a small discount (30$ to park overnite, not bad for Manhattan). We had breakfast included, a bit crowded but we were there Christmas week, but the breakfast was hot and plentiful. Staff were lovely they kept our bags for us the next day when we checked out. No problem noted with our stay. It's not super deluxe, but nice enough to stay and enjoy. Worth it, not a bank breaker, if you want a quick getaway.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: When we arrived very early from our international flight the staff greeted us warmly and checked us in before 8am... fantastic!!! Everyone we interacted with, greeted is with a smile... everyone was professional and personable! Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: It is a little off the beaten path but a good price and near good food in Hell's Kitchen. Nice, clean rooms. The service was great starting with Ashley at check-in to the staff in the breakfast area the next morning. All friendly and helpful. The breakfast was hearty with eggs, bacon, sausage.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This was my second visit to New York and the first visit to the Holiday Inn, 538 West, 48th Street...rooms very clean and comfortable, there is a fridge which is great, but no kettle, ...however, unusually for hotels in America, this one provided within the reception area, hot drinks facilities and a ready supply of boiling hot water so you could make your own drinks (24 hrs a day)...which was a real plus...do, take your own teabags if you don't like any other tea but the good old PG Tips though....There was a breakfast included in the cost of the hotel....difficult for me to review this though as I only had toast...as waffles and such really is not my 'cup of tea'...The staff were lovely and very helpful...the hotel is set in the residential area, so, unlike many of the larger hotels is quiet...which is a real plus.....but is located near enough to comfortably access all the attractions such as Broadway, Times Sqare in a shortish walk..... there are a good selection of Restaurants nearby.....we would hotly recommend you try Crispins, a great liittle Italian.....and do look up Jack Dempseys Irish Bar, near the Empire State Building.Will certainly re visit this particular Holiday Inn again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My husband and I went to bring in the new year in NYC, we have never been so wanted to try something new and wasn't sure where to stay so we stayed at this hotel upon arrival and checking in we were given our room key and we headed down the elevator only to realizeWe were placed in the dungeon along with the housekeepers and janitors employees and closets I was pretty upset but told my husband hey we should be ok maybe it's not that bad!! We stepped out and tried to hang in there Waiting for the ball to drop it was to cold out we decided to watch the ballDrop from our room, from10:30pm through out the entire NITE all we heard was employees laughing talking yelling doors slamming there was no sleep for us at all the entire NITE...we complained when checking out and it was more like sorry but oh well after paying close to 300 for the NITE I expected a better stay and a better attitude fromThe staff...totally ridiculous!ll will never recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. The staff are really friendly and helpful.The breakfasts are great with breakfast buns and a one touch pancake machine.The rooms are small but comfortable and clean.I will stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed here for a week 12th December - rooms small but suitable for all we needed - four people sharing one room - breakfast very basic but for the price it was fine - disposable plates and cups - had a nice waffle machine to make your own - fresh muffins and toast if wanted - cereal American style :) fresh fruit - staff very friendly - hotel very central to our needs - few streets away from main attractions - would stay here again :)

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We booked the stay last minute as we found a good deal online for a quick escape and fun in the city during the holidays and were pleasantly surprised. While the rooms are small, you get what you pay for, it was a great value. The hotel was clean, the staff very friendly and the location near Times Sq was ideal, however, as convenient as taxis and the subway is in New York I don't worry about location as much. The added breakfast was a real bonus, a bit crowded, but hot selections...fruit, pancakes, waffles, eggs, yogurt, etc...would I stay there again? Most definitely!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My teenaged daughter, her best friend and I stayed in this hotel for the New York City New Year's Eve experience and had a great time. The best thing about this hotel was the warm friendliness of the staff. Everyone we came in contact with was welcoming and friendly: the front desk personnel gave good directions and let us check out late, the staffers continually refilled the breakfast items (and kept the breakfast area open and stocked until 10 a.m. on New Year's day, half an hour later than the stated closing time), and the housekeeper gave us extra shampoo and lotion.Our room on the seventh floor had two double beds and, while not large, was big enough for the three of us. The beds were very comfortable. There were room-darkening shades, but I preferred to keep the shades open to see the night view of the city. The shower had great water pressure. There is a small exercise room in the basement.The hotel is an easy walk (10 - 15 minutes) from Times Square. It's also close to streets that have almost every kind of restaurant imaginable and even a 24-hour convenience store. The area felt safe enough that going out on at night was not a problem. This seemed to be a residential area, with lots of apartments and stores people would need for everyday life, so it was interesting to experience a neighborhood that was not overwhelmingly touristy.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed at this hotel the weekend after Christmas and enjoyed the time we had there. The rooms were small but comfortable and clean. The hotel is close enough to walk to Times Square and also within walking distance to Herald Square. It was a great location for walking to all of our activities. The concierge was very helpful and the check in process easy and stress free. The hot breakfast was a plus and those that refilled the food and drink were so pleasant and cheerful! There is always hot beverages available in the lobby and even some chocolate chip cookies! WE would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed at this hotel with a friend and we were able to request two double beds ahead of time from the very friendly front desk staff. The stay exceeded expectations, with a clean and quiet room, hot free breakfast (this is unusual!), coffee and tea always available, and a terrific location near Times Square and all Midtown attractions. The best part of our stay, however, was an extremely friendly and attentive staff. Everyone we came into contact with -- from the front desk manager to the breakfast wait staff -- was polite, attentive and asking what they could do for us. This is the sign of a well-run hotel and I would gladly stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed at this hotel with my daughter the weekend before Christmas. The accommodations were clean and comfortable, but what made the stay was the staff. The General Manager was at the desk when we checked in, she was so friendly and helpful- you could tell she loves her job. She staffs her hotel with friendly, professional and very helpful employees who do everything possible to exceed your expectations. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed in a King City View room mid-December 2014 for a medical conference located in Times Square. I used to live in NYC for 20yrs so I am fully aware how busy Times Square can be during the holiday season. This Holiday Inn Express is conveniently located on the outskirts of Hell's Kitchen, far enough away from the crowds, but close enough to all of the conveniences of Hell's Kitchen i.e. restaurants, transportation, bars, drug stores, etc. Breakfast was included for my stay. I preferred eating at my favorite restaurants for breakfast, but the Holiday Inn spread was pretty substantial. They served eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, toast, cereal, etc. I was allowed to early check-in. They called my cell phone when the room was ready. I stayed on the top floor (either 11th or 12th). I had a nice city view. The room had a mini-fridge and safe. The staff was very friendly. My only complaint is that the neighborhood can be noisy from police, ambulance and fire trucks sirens. This is in no way the fault of the hotel. I had a good night sleep with the assistance of ear plugs.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights with my husband and a couple of friends, a week before Christmas this year. Rooms were small, but nice and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in the price and was actually really good, better than expected! The best asset of this hotel is its location. Only few minutes walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, The Empire State Building; a short ride to MSG and Central Park...Overall a really nice hotel, will stay there next time I'm in town.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Hotel is clean & comfortable, and staff is very courteous & helpful. In town to see Christmas lights and stayed using a IHG credit card award night. The room is literally the back side of the elevator shaft. Interestingly though, elevator noise was tolerable. Noise from the hallways wasn't though. Voices of inconsiderate late night arrivers could be heard as if they were standing in our room. A rolled up towel along the bottom of the door did nothing to help. And this was with most of our room separated from the hallway by the elevators. Had to step out and ask the dingalings to quieten down their kids. The provided breakfast was edible but the breakfast area was super crowded. As the front desk clerk said when we checked in, get there early if possible.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed for a week and although the room was a little small, it was clean and adequate. Coffee making facilities in the room plus tea, coffee and hot cider available from the breakfast room. Breakfast was good and the staff extremely helpful. Less than 10 minutes walk from Times Square and near to the Hell's Kitchen area. Only disappointment was that we left an item in the safe in the room and despite 3 phone calls and an e-mail, the Hotel has not come back to us about whether they have retrieved it. We will keep trying, and hope that their customer service is up to it!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Pros: Great Staff, New Hotel, Price, Free BreakfastCons: SMALL Rooms, Location is a bit far from some popular places and the subway.The location is off the beaten path, near the Enterprise and a bit far east, but that is ok. It let us see a lot of stuff we wouldn't have seen otherwise. The staff is over the top friendly. I mean they totally understand that the guest is the reason they have a job. I loved the outdoor patio. We ran and grabbed some beers at the local store and sat out each night "people watching" and enjoying the sounds of the city.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed at the HI Express West Side in early December for one night while I toured around New York City with my wife and 2 kids. While the rooms are small (what room in NYC isn't?), the hotel was very clean and the furnishings were nice. Beds were comfortable and it was a short walk to Times Square. Breakfast in the morning had plenty of options, both hot and cold. The front desk staff was very friendly and they stored our luggage for us on Sunday morning after we checked out while we messed around in the city. The price was reasonable and I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed for 7 days and the staff really made us feel so very welcome! John and Ferrell in the breakfast went out of their way to serve us every day. We loved, loved, loved our stay and hated to leave. Next time we go to NYC we will stay here again without a doubt!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel was clean and well run. I felt safe here. The rooms are small, but I was only there to shower and sleep. Considering we were in NY, it was reasonably quiet. We were several blocks from the nearest subway station, but all of NY seems to be blocks of walking. The breakfast bar was varied and well stocked. The staff was very courteous and eager to serve. John and Farrellwere very pleasant. Overall, this was a good stay.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel is very clean, the rooms are a little small... and when I see the comments, we were unlucky because our bed wasn't King Size.The staff is very nice... and If you meet Farrell you will find a pleasant person who's always have a smile and a special attention for you... Farrell, if you see this message, do not hesitate to send us an email (I give it to you just before leaving... remember we were a family with 2 little boys who's still ask you for chocolate or pancake !!!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Very comfortable and clean room, with all services needed.The personnel is very nice and very helpful. My door was dysfunctional and it was fixed in 10 minutes.The breakfast is average: not very good pastries, fake maple sirup...The hotel is in "hell's kitchen", there is nothing really interesting in this district. It is 20 minutes walk from Times Square, so if you are ok to walk, it can do.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Very good hotel, very well located, breakfast is simple but efficient and good, buffet style, staff is ensuring there is food and that you don't miss anything.Reception is very accommodating, lending electric adaptator.Fitness room not used, central park is at 10 min run. Went twice running at central park, amazing!!The only point to be enhanced is elevator, it's very long to get your chance in the morning when everybody is getting to breakfast, even more when you're last floor 11th!I recommend to ask for a room backyard side to about street noise.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed at this hotel with my two girlfriends & totally loved it. The rooms are cosy, clean & warm. They are of a standard medium size. The breakfast in the morning was always fresh, hot & plenty. The staff in the morning couldn't do enough for us. They were always pleasant, friendly & smiling even though they had been at work since 4am! Free tea & coffee all day was great especially when coming in from cold after an exhausting day sight seeing. Oh & they even had delicious freshly baked choc chip cookies at around tea time which was a nice surprise!The managers & all the staff on reception desk were most helpful in suggesting places to eat & helping us plan our day. I would like to say a very thank you to Aniket & Richard for all the do's & don't tips and friendly advice even when we went on to Miami! Love u guys! ❤️The hotel is in a good location & within walking distance to Times Square & various subway stations including Port Authority which is also a bus station & overground train station.All in all we enjoyed our stay & I'm so glad we picked this Holiday Inn out of all the others in the city for all the reasons above. If and when I visit NY again I will definitely be coming back to stay here as ticks all the boxes!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We were here for a 5 day stay. The Staff was friendly& accommodating from the time we arrived. We received immediate & courteous response for any of our needs. Rooms were clean & very comfortable. Would stay again if ever in NYC!
user_name:
Julie H
Columbus, Ohio, United States

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I came in on Monday, December 1st to check-in for 1 night & I was greeted by the guest service agent Karen. Once she asked me for a cc for the MOP I asked her can I pay the RT in cash & she said I can do it at check-out but I knew I had to leave for the airport at 4 am so I told her I would prefer to pay now so that the hold for RT wouldn't be placed on the card & she stated to me if I paid in cash that I had pay an additional 200.00 for incidentals & because I am in management for IHG & being a customer to this particular Property more than once I knew that wasn't correct. So I asked her was she sure & she said to me that's the hotel's policy. Usually I can pay my RT in Cash & leave a cc for incidentals of between 25 -100 dollars per night. She began to get very loud with me & I asked to speak with a manager & I was told there was no MOD & I told her I would contact her Front Office Manager & she told me "you can contact the GM if you want, the owner if that makes you feel better" then she told me " it's always our kind (black people) that have to be extra" I was verrrryyyy offended being a professional in the hospitality industry & in front of other hotel guests. I told her with the kind of attitude she have she will forever be a GSA because that was far from customer service I received. She argued with me for about 10 minutes before throwing my money back on the counter & telling Matthew (who was also standing right next to her while all if this was going on) to check me in because she wasn't doing it. I asked him did he not see an issue with the racial comment she made (regardless if she's the same race, it's inappropriate) & he told me "oh I wasn't paying attention" which was absurd because it was a big scene made & then he proceeded to telling me I can pay room & tax in cash & hold 50.00 on my cc which is what I had been requesting from the very beginning!!!! Absolute worst service I have ever received EVER!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Didn't know what to expect as all hotels are so expensive but this one was close by the production studio we were going to visit. It has very small rooms (king took up the whole room) and you had to turn and move in to close the bathroom door it's so small hoooowever... Very comfortable bed, great shower, well appointed, comfortable all around! And the breakfast was a wonderful treat with pancakes, biscuits/gravy, omelets, oatmeal...you get the drift ! It's not 5 star breakfast but totally fills everyone's wants and needs. I would totally stay here again! It's a bit of a walk from any action or sightseeing but it's quieter than those area's too which is better . Very happy with our house this visit !

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I am glad I booked this hotel for my recent 3 night stay in NY. As a single female in NYC on the way home from a business trip I was a little worried about location but I needn't have bothered worrying. I felt safe, it was only a 5 to 10 minute walk to Times Square (depending on if I dawdled) and the hotel itself was very clean, modern and comfortable. I was on the 4th floor and was concerned about noise from the traffic as it does not appear to be double glazed but had no issues. The rooms are very small but suited my purpose. The bed was very comfortable, the staff very friendly and eager to assist. There is a complimentary breakfast if you can get into the small area reserved for breakfast in the mornings, I opted to wander and buy breakfast elsewhere. In all I would stay here again. Good value for money.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I had an enjoyable stay when I came for the NYC Marathon as part of a package tour. The complimentary breakfast in the mornings provided a great way to start the day. I really enjoyed the turkey sausages! Hotel staff was very friendly. Hotel was clean and comfortable. On the morning of the marathon, the hotel even provided a special breakfast kit for all the runners due to the early start and the normal breakfast service was not available yet.My room was on the second floor and I just used the stairs instead of the elevator. There is a small fitness room on the main floor. Free wi-fi was reliable. Bathroom had only a shower and no bathtub. Bed was very comfortable and room was very quiet. Taxi from LaGuardia Airport to hotel was $46 before tip.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed here for two nights when in town to see some Broadway shows. The staff was delightful from the moment we came in the door until the moment we caught our cab to the airport after check out. The rooms are bright, super clean and extremely comfortable. We had a Superior King room with a bed that could lull you into a deep sleep after about 5 seconds. Nice bathroom, good free breakfast every morning and complimentary coffee all day long. I will be returning in March and am looking forward to staying here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: GREAT staff! Nice hotel! Close to Times Square!There were a ton of great food options near by. Uncle Mario's (on 9th ave south of 49th st I think?) had GREAT pizza and pasta. Just came back from celebrating my mom's birthday and her first trip to New York. This was my second time staying in Manhattan and this hotel was SO much better than the other hotel I stayed in. This hotel is located in Hell's Kitchen so there are lots of great food options near by. It's only a short walk over to Times Square or the nearest subway station. The rooms were very clean, very comfortable bed, great shower. Breakfast is included every day and was good! The staff at this hotel were amazing. I had read reviews when booking this hotel that mentioned that the staff were great and they were absolutely correct! So friendly and incredibly helpful!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed here for 1 night after my Quantum of the Seas cruise. I've sent clients here before for their pre/post cruise vacations but had never stayed here personally until now (I'm a travel agent). The hotel is in a great area - close the the Manhattan pier, and close enough for a nice walk over to the Times Square area. It's located on a residential street, so walking the area felt very safe.Ashley and all of the front desk staff were great - very welcoming and friendly. The room was good and included a very comfortable bed and mini-fridge. I love HI Express hotels for the value you get without breaking the bank - free Wifi, free printing (for boarding passes), and free hot breakfast. What more can you ask for? Considering Manhattan can be very expensive even at lower star rated hotels, this hotel is a hidden gem. It's not a 5 star rated hotel, but the service and experience I had during my 1 night was definitely 5 star - everyone who worked there that I came into contact with gave me 5 star service all the way. This speaks volumes since first impressions can make or break any hotel stay. I'll continue recommending this hotel to clients and will surely stay here again on my next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My daughter and I share a room with a friend. Two double beds in tight quarters. The room was clean. The beds were ok to sleep on. The front desk workers were pleasant and helpful. We walked around Times Square in the cold all day, so we were satisfied with this choice.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I visited this property last week with my wife and my 7 year old son. This property is between the 10th and 11th Ave on 48th St. The location and the service makes it excellent value for money property. The front desk staff was always ready to help whether it was getting a couple of extra bottles of water or information about sightseeing or ensuring that my kid were fully engaged while having breakfast (without even requesting they switched channels on the TV to cartoons). The location of the hotel is very good if you want to visit places like Times Square (42nd-50th St. & 7th Ave) or Rockefeller Center or Central Park. The hotel provides for free wifi, free printouts, free tea and coffee 24 hours. The breakfast spread is reasonable. My kid loved making fresh pancakes on the 1 minute machine :).You may use the subway system very often in NYC for local sightseeing not just for cost saving but also for time saving. This makes the locations very accessible. The C,E Trains at 7th Ave & 50th Street are @ 7-10 minutes walk.The Hotel also arranged a drop for us to JFK for all inclusive fee of $75. This may be slightly more expensive than usual but it was truly comfortable given we had a big SUV for our pickup. However, please note that the hotel is about 16 miles from JFK and may take a good 1 hour 15 minutes during peak traffic hours.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Had a great and perfect stay , the breakfast was good and the staff allways on point making sure nothing was missing for us finding any ways to accomodate us. Would love to thank specially guys on the front desk Juan , Rchard , Mathew and Julio , who was attending guest with there luggage and breakfast Great Job !

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed here for one night in November. Only a 15 minute walk to Times Square area. Room was clean and looked well taken care of. Breakfast was offered in the morning by folks who seemed to want to do a good job. Interaction with staff throughout the stay was always pleasant. The only thing we found slightly bothersome was the slow elevators. Used the stairs when we could. A good selection of restaurants and bars in the area. Tried out the Landsdowne Road Pub which was only a few blocks down10th. A fun place to watch games. Overall a good stay.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed at this hotel recently and it was a total dump to say the least. Upon checking in we were greeted by one of the rudest front desk people I have ever encountered. It was as if i was inconveniencing them to check into the hotel, which I paid a ridiculous price for. Then when I got to my room I was greeted with dark little hairs all over my bed, pillows, and in the shower and sink. The room was so small you could barely walk past the bed without hitting into things. The room also smelled like an old gym locker which someone had been heavily smoking in for the last decade. When I called down to the front desk to complain I was told the hotel was at almost full capacity and there was no where I could move to. Also, since it was after the cancellation time for that day they were going to charge me for my stay anyway. Being from out of the area and staying at many different Holiday Inn's over the years I did not know where else to go and just stayed put. To top it all off the next morning I attempted to explain my circumstance to multiple employees with no success, again only to encounter rude individuals who could care less about my stay or the customer service which I was provided. I would NEVER suggest anyone to go to this hotel.
user_name:
Mark S
Long Island, New York

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I have stayed all over the world for business and experienced mostly 4-5 star hotels. I came here at short notice and booked a little dubious about the hotel. i think for a value location, a simple hotel that offers clean basic rooms and good service you can't go wrong. Especially if you are on business and in and out just using the room to sleep. yes the breakfast is not great and a busy room, but its a great price on 48th. i would recommend to the savvy traveller who wants to focus on New York.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is relatively new and our room was quite a good size for New York. A good tip is to book a room with 2 double beds, even if there are only 2 of you, as you get a better sized room. The major downside of this hotel is, it is a 15 minute walk from Times Square. When you do it twice a day, on top of all the site seeing you do, it's very tiring. Also the area is not very nice (opposite the salvation army) and major building work going on opposite, so noisy from 7am. Would be better to have a room on the back.Our room was not cleaned very well and the bathroom wasn't cleaned 2 days running and toilet paper not replaced. We had left loose change on the bedside table and it went missing. We notified the manager and she said she would deal with it, but it made us feel very uncomfortable leaving anything of any value in the room. On the plus side most of the staff we encountered were lovely, especially Farrell who always had a smile on his face and was very helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is new and the decor is the new style Express.It is a typical New York Hotel room . Big enough for the bed and a wonderful built in . The bathroom is very modern. The bed (King) was very comfortable and the noise from out side was not noticeable except for one police siren in the middle of the night. The room was very clean and the staff looked you in the eye and greeted you. I would certainly satay there again. The parking is on 49th and the hotel will stamp your check for a nice reduction in price on an overnight stay.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We have just returned from a 3 day trip to the city. This place is like a hidden gem! The staff all of them from front desk, breakfast staff, cleaning staff are by far the most friendly and helpful!! So pleased with how clean this place was. Yes the rooms are small but when in nyc you really are not looking to sleep much. There were 4 of us in a room and lots of shopping bags and we managed just fine! We needed more towels they were there in minutes with them! I highly recommend staying here.
user_name:
MaryJoG788
Rome, New York, United States

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel had a typically small New York City hotel room, but it was clean and well appointed. Climate control was accessible and good. The complimentary breakfast had a wide selection of items, and was very crowded each day. The quality of the food was adequate - typical of this type of hotel breakfast. The strongest aspect of this hotel was the staff. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, courteous and helpful, from the front desk to the breakfast room to the housekeeping staff. The location of the hotel was convenient to many restaurant choices.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is located about a 15-20min walk to times square and has plenty of restaurants nearby.The hotel itself is pretty basic but clean and comfortable.The walls are fairly thin though so it can be pretty noisy. Staff were helpful and breakfast was ok.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff here goes out of their way to make our stay comfortable. They have even made accommodations for a food allergy.Thank you Farrell! The hotel is clean and in a terrific location for us. It is close enough to everything we need, just just far enough from Times Square so that we avoid the chaos!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We had a great stay for 7 nights. The location is good and close to almost everything. The breakfast and the service were really good and you could get coffee and water/other beverages anytime.Farrell was exceptional: you can't really have a bad day, when he comes to your breakfast table every single day smiling at you and always trying to help and to make you feel comfortable; perfect!Sasha, Italy.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: All the folks were vey friendly and in particular Kelley at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty to assist me. They made me feel VERY welcome there and offered several alternatives to address my concerns

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Liked our 5 day stay here! clean, modern, helpful and friendly staff who were only to happy to help with any tourism advice. Complimentary WiFi also a nice touch! Really good Base, located on West 48th street, it is Less than 10 minutes walk from times square, which is about 4 blocks away and 5 minutes walk from the USS Intrepid! Pretty decent breakfast buffet. Alotnofnchoice, pastries, cereals and lots of fruit and light bights on offer. Beds very comfy, after all you need rest after pounding the pavements up and down manhatten! Would stay here again! Thankyou!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Couldn't fault this hotel - helpful staff; great buffet breakfast; clean and comfortable room - we even had a view of the Hudson River :-) This hotel is not too far from the subway and there are plenty of shops, restaurants and bars within a reasonable walking distance. You will have to walk/ride to the main 'attractions' but this is part of the NYC experience.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Good price for a hotel close to almost everything. I got a good impression about the theirs staff always helpful helping with any questions or request. Always clean.Theirs breakfast area was to small and you have to go early for breakfast to find a place.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We moved from a grotty holiday inn hotel on 26th street to this hotel.Lovely room, comfy beds, great breakfast. All the staff friendly and helpful.Just a few blocks (10 minute walk at most) to time square and main bus stop for hop on hop off bus (big bus company). Felt very safe here (2 x 40 year old ladies - on a shopping/sightseeing trip)Would recommend - family hotel

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Hotel was a 10 to 15 minute walk to the nearest subway station and a 5 to 10 minute walk to the nearest bus stop. The walk to Times Square was around 15 minutes. Breakfast Excellent, room smallish and bed very comnfortable. In a quiet location away from the main drag and we thought it was pleasant walking through the residential streets surrounding the hotel. Very close to the Cruise Terminal and the Entrepid Museum. We were tempted by the low cost of accomodation, with breakfast, to our first choice of a Holiday Express in Times Square where the price of our accomodation shot up in price. Across the road is a Salvation Army hostel and the view out of our window was across roofs of buildings and not at all picturesque. In all we prefer a hotel within easy distance of public transport which this wasn't.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Perfect location to explore the Big Apple! Hotel location accessible to Brooklyn, Lower Eastside, Harlem, the Bronx and Central Park via public transportation and centrally located to 50th Street Station. Located in the heart of Hell's Kitchen and walking distance to Times Square, Rockafeller Plaza, a variety of shows, bars, music and eating venues.Staff is extremely helpful with the ability to provide a wealth of knowledge to enable you to function like a native. Facility provides a great daily breaksfast and is equipped with fitness equipment for the active guest. Upon check-in and throughout your stay, you are consistently greeted by the hotel's friendly staff members i.e. Juan, Farrell (who kept a smile even during the height breakfast while keeping the area clean and stocked), Julio was awesome, informative, as well provided great assistance securing our luggage, going above and beyond with customer service.Holiday Inn Express New York - Manhattan West Side was a very clean, budget friendly and perfectly located to meet the needs of any traveler. I would be honored to stay here again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed there for 4 days, the first impression was really good. The hotel is new and the staff... amazing. The rooms are not to big, but if you compare with other hotels in NY they are pretty decent. The breakfast is also good, you will save tons of money having this breakfast at the hotel instead of pay to have it somewhere. If you need something else they will try to get it for you. I f you have any questions fell free to go to the front desk, they will help you. My only problem was with the maiden, we left around 10am every day and requested to have the room organized and towels replaced, but even coming back after 3pm she was not able to go into our room. Maybe is not enough people to the amount of rooms. Also elevators during the morning can be really busy, you have to wait a lot for one of them. I was on the 8th floor, very quiet from the outside, but extremely noisy from the hallway, terrible. I could hear every single word said in the other end. Overall a good experience, will be back and recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: A great location and a wonderful staff is waiting for you at this hotel! The service was excellent and highly professional. The staff was always there to help, whether is was regarding finding special shops and stores or to find a nice restaurant for the evening. The rooms and bathrooms are not too big, but the beds are wonderful - and think about it; do you really need anything else when you're in a city which never sleeps?

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Easy access from Manhattan cruise terminal and close to Broadway and Time Square. Clean comfortable room but a bit small but then this is NY. Nice breakfast. Staff was helpful and friendly. Special tip of the hat to John for helping us navigate around the city.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: As a child I was told a story that stated that no matter the size of the house, room size does not matter, what matters is the neighbors, I tell it At the beginning of my words because the rooms at this hotel are not too big, somewhat slow elevators. No central location (although for us it was excellent). But ... the team ... I think that the hotel manager should be proud of such a team. Start: we arrived early in the morning, greeted us receptionist whose name I do not remember (sorry), After we offered to leave our bags in the luggage storage we were surprised when we offered to sit down for breakfast, we were not eligible for breakfast on the first day and still they invited us, already gave us a good feeling. In the dining room we got to know the most amazing hotel employee: Farrell, the man simply charmed us his courtesy, his sincere desire to make friends with us and give wholehearted service. he cared for things the kids likes to eat, when he came to recognize were we came from and knows that vegetables are part of our meals he rushed to take care that and gave us plates full of fresh vegetables for the all stay.Throughout the short stay made ​​above and beyond for us. Farrell is definitely an asset to the hotel. Thank you Farrell. As for breakfast: some reviews thought it not enough? !! What should a person nead for breakfast? There's a selection of pastries, a selection of cereals, hot and cold beverages, eggs, cheese, pancakes, waffles What else should a person ask for a successful start for his day. That was enough for us above and beyond (and especially our son whom it is hard to please when it comes to food).Hotel Location: The hotel was stated to us in an excellent location, it is just about five minutes walk with luggage from the cruis peers (we left the hotel and took a cruis from peer 88) Ten minute walk and we are in Time Square.The room we got was not the largest but fit our expectations. In any case it is in New York City and most of the day in the outdoors. Basic room with two beds, a comfortable bathroom. Definitely enough. The night before departure the kids expressed disappointment that we have to leave Farrell behind . We all agreed it was fun to stay at the hotel and we will return to it at the first opportunity.In conclusion, we all highly recommend the Holiday Inn Express New York - Manhattan West Side and thank all the staff for a wonderful stay. Thank you and see you soon.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Great location (short walk to Broadway and Times Square.), VERY clean, attentive and courteous and attentive staff. Bathroom sink counter space very small but overall even though small, bathroom acceptable. Breakfast maybe not gourmet but a good variety of items. Would definitely return.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The Holiday Inn Express on 48th Street in NYC is a great place to stay in NYC for its location and staff. I stay at many IHG properties as a loyal Platinum Member. I choose this location for the location mainly as I visit several times a year for business and seeing relatives. The rooms are small but very clean and efficient. The staff is welcoming and very attentive to the customer needs. I especially want to single out Farrel who was attendant on staff during our stay. Farrel was working in the breakfast room area. He was very professional, courteous and pleasant. As a frequent traveler I look for several things in a hotel…. Cleanliness, location, and courteous and helpful staff. This IHG property has them all. Congrats!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Great location within walking distance of Broadway shows, Times Square, shopping, etc. The rooms are very small, but clean. The breakfast is included and excellent with scrambled eggs, pancakes, waffles, bacon, sausage, cereals and pastries. Very good value.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Good locations right near the piers...very clean! good breakfast ..friendly people ., outside deck and many things that they offer for you to nyc , parking is a block away and they stamp your ticket for a discount..negative point is that the rooms and even the elevaters are small but i guess thats ny

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The location was great, especially being ready to walk my way through NYC. 50 St. station is just a few blocks a way. You go anywhere from there. And you can stop on 9th for whatever food craving your heart (and tummy) desires, at all hours! Also near Hell's Kitchen flea on weekends. Customer service was great, even beyond that, they're friendly folks who want you to feel at home at HIE. Julio kindly took care of us and handled our luggage, despite our obvious shopping addiction and extra bags. Not sure of his name, but the guy who maintained the eating area despite the zombie stampede for free breakfast -he had an unwavering positive attitude and friendliness. Front desk staff were consistently great, too.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel Oct 11-15, 2014. The hotel is located on W 48th Street between 10 & 11 Ave (closer to 11 Ave). Customer service is very good but the breakfast is mediocre at best. The small dining area is over-crowded at all times over breakfast which is only served to 9:30 am on weekdays & 10 am on weekends. I'm on vacation so 9:30 am is too early to close up. As per NYC Transit, it's 0.55 miles (0.88 km) to the nearest subway (stop 50 St on the C.E line). Look it up, it's quite a walk.....the Avenues are very long and the Streets are short so you have to walk 2.5 long blocks East and 2 short blocks West. I wouldn't do this walk with grumpy, tired children.This hotel would be great for pre & post cruise, events at the Javit's Center (ie Comic Con) or if you want to be close to the Intrepid Museum. Otherwise, everything is accessible by subway, bus, taxi or walking a long, long way.If you are staying at this hotel, here are some tips to get to places:Central Park: take the #12 bus from 12 Ave (along the water) directly to Columbus Circle (W 59 St & 8 Ave). It goes every 20 minutes. Or walk 11 short blocks North and 2.5 long blocks East.A Gentleman's Guide to Love and Murder is near the 50 St subway stop.Highline walkway starts at W 34 St between 11 & 12 Ave. Walk the 14 short blocks or get on the #12 bus on 11 Ave and get off at 34 St.Intrepid Museum: Walk to 12 Ave and South along the pierGotham West Market: Walk a couple short blocks South to 600 11 Ave.The hotel offers you a shuttle to Newark for $26 per person. It's only $12.75 per person if you take the NJ Transit from Penn Station. The NYC and NJ Transit online gives you an optional trip planner for buses and subways which I highly recommend.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed at the HIE this thanksgiving the hotel was nice, continental breakfast was always stocked, staff was friendly, and rooms were clean. Can't really complain about this hotel the location is great it's just a short walk to Central Park and Times Square!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I cannot begin to express how much my hubby and I enjoyed our stay here. The morning we got there I am afraid I was a bit of a diva because I had been up 36 hours and the people at the front desk were so friendly and helpful. It was our first trip to NYC and then we were going to go on a cruise from there we could not have chosen any better. Walk out the front door and turn left and you can see the cruise terminal two blocks down, turn right and walk three blocks and you are in the middle of Times Square and add an extra block left and you are on the Intrepid and then everywhere in-between is Hell's Kitchen and a food orgy for any "foodie" . We walked all over NYC and had a ball and then came back to one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The place is immaculate and we were able to leave our luggage until we could check in on our arrival. Breakfast was wonderful but it is crowded like the other reviews say but they do provide boxes so you can take your breakfast back up to your room, which I did so I could have breakfast in bed and watch the morning news before we headed back out to enjoy New York. It was a little more expensive but I would definitely pay that again for the convenience. Compared with all the transportation cost I saved it was well worth it. Again I cannot say how wonderful the staff was. We had a little problem with our TV because of a little short in the wiring but they had someone up to our room to fix it in minutes. Our next trip to NYC will definitely include a stay here again. I would definitely suggest this if you want to come in early or stay after a cruise. Just grab your luggage and a quick walk and you will be there!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed in the Holiday Inn Express from the 28th of September till the 2nd of October and had an enjoyable stay.Recption staff were very friendly and welcoming,breakfast included each morning with a wide selection of hot and cold food from bacon and eggs to waffles and cereal again staff at the breakfast area were excellent and couldn't do enough to make sure you had everything you needed.Only thing was the breakfast area isn't the biggest for the size of the hotel,first morning we went down at 7am and the breakfast area was empty but as the week went on we went down a little later and by the end of stay we had to take our breakfast to our room.Rooms were very nice with 2 very comfy double beds nice bathroom with shower TV and a fridge.Very close to Time Square about a 15 minute walk also very close to the Hudson River about 5 minutes away.Hell's Kitchen Bars and Restaurants just around the corner.All in all a lovely hotel,lovely staff and close to Time Square.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: they were so friendly... Farrell, Karen, Alex, Melvin, Ashley, Julio< and Kelley... I hope I didn't for get any one... thank you for making my stay ...a wonderful experience..... and making my Birthday so special...

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: $250 a night ! Breakfast of reconstituted eggs - self served on plastic plates with plastic cutlery - self serve coffee in plastic cups.Cramped dining room - everyone bashing into each other. Terrible.$250 a night !No complimentary bottled water in room - in fact no stocked mini bar at all. Forced to either use vending machines or drink from Tap ( NY water is good I here - I hope so )$250 a night !Poor lighting in room for work - huge desk light gets in the way of the laptop - just strange$250 a night !Shower tray is dirty - orange slime - and mouldy coming through.Noisy rooms - I can hear every move next door and above make. Sound proofing is none existant.PositivesBed is great - slept well in it.TV is nice and well situatedDesk staff have been fineBut lots to sort out and for the price it should be more premium - but feel it is budget at best.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in September. The staff was over the top with kindness and very helpful. Some people are complaining about the breakfast - the breakfast is FREE, what are they complaining about? Some people you just can't please! In my opinion, just about every type of food you could eat was there - waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage, eggs, cereals, fresh fruits, granola, yogurts, juices, tea, and coffee. Guests were provided with water, tea and coffee any time of day in the lobby. I even found iced tea a few times and fruit water. The location of this hotel was a little further from Times Square than I prefer and it could be a little creepy at night walking the 4 or 5 blocks passing residents on their porches smoking weed, but that is not the fault of the hotel. The manager of this hotel does a great job in making sure his/her staff give great customer service!
user_name:
Ilovemymercedes
On A Stoney Hill, MD

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My wife came across this hotel on TravelPony when she was looking for a last minute central-ish place for my dad and me (yes it's 'my dad and me' - us - and NOT 'my dad and I' - we) to stay at and here popped up this affordable hotel. The location is nice, though it's a bit of a walk from Times Square and other central places. There are no eateries or mini-marts in the immediate vicinity. The rooms are small but clean and the staff is surprisingly friendly by NYC standard! We stayed there for two nights and while the breakfast is advertised as free, it's nothing to rave about. Almost everything is average and tastes like it's made of plastic. I think we didn't even bother with it the second morning. The elevators can take forever since there are only two. I probably wouldn't recommend it for families even though many families were staying probably because the price was great. But for my dad and me, it was just perfect.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My Stay at the Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West was perfect!! Couldn’t have asked for a better stay. I came from Washington DC, the bus dropped me at Penn Station and I walked to the hotel. Very very nice walk through the city not too long of a walk at all. Once I got to the hotel I was greeted by Jaun who checked me in. Extremely pleasant. Recognized my IHG membership greeted me with a warm friendly smile. Also Julio was there as well and answered any questions we had about the city gave us great suggestions on places to go in the city. My room was a good size bit small but . . .. hey we are in NYC I don’t except anything more perfect size for us two ladies we had plenty of space. I even called back a couple of days later to get the names of the employees that assisted me during my stay. Karen was extremely helpful and pleasant and was able to provide me with the information I needed. Great job Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West! Best stay in a while. I have worked in the hotel industry for more than 10 years and stayed at many hotels. Every trip I make to NYC I will try to stay at this property.. . . . PS loved the outside porch area.
user_name:
MsGeneus
Silver Spring, Maryland, United States

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We arrive at the Hotel on September for 5 days, the room are quite small and basic , but clean the staff are really friendly, particularly Richard,John & Yung . Holiday Inn. Free Tea & Coffee in reception, so you can pick up a cup after a day out without having to wait for water to boil. Yes the Breakfast room is small, but if you catch nice weather the patio area give additional place to sit. Well worth checking it out!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Richard at the front desk was amazing! Lots of great service all around, but Richard was a standout. Great location, too. The only glitch was the city turned off the water on the last day of the stay. Very inconvenient, but the hotel offered bottled water for essentials.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: First holiday in over 4 years, and first since being diagnosed as Coeliac. Whilst they don't shout about it, this Holiday Inn Express serves Gluten Free options at breakfast - a major factor when choosing somewhere to stay for me.Better still, it's a short walk from Times Square and the hustle and bustle of New York City, but still in a quiet(ish) location so you're not kept up all night with traffic noise.
