The staff are really friendly, particularly Jon and the other two guys serving Breakfast (I missed their names). Rooms are clean, comfortable, if basic - but then it's a Holiday Inn. Free Tea & Coffee in reception, so you can pick up a cup after a day out without having to wait for water to boil.Yes the Breakfast room is small, but if you catch nice weather (I was lucky) the patio area is a lovely place to sit and people watch in the mornings, couldn't quite work out why so few people used it. All in all, a comfortable, convenient place to stay in New York, close to major attractions. Well worth checking it out!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed at the Property on Friday September 19th through Sunday September 21st.I was in NYC for a Conference at the Javits Convention Center. The Hotel is in a perfect location.It was about a 15-20 minute walk to the Convention Center.The room was clean and new as was the rest of the Hotel. The Main reason I am writing this is Because of the employee named Farrell, who is by far the Friendliest, Sweetest, most Outgoing, Knowledgeable and Attentive Hotel Employees I have ever encountered. He was working Saturday morning as well as Sunday morning as the Breakfast attendant. Both morning he greeted my friends and I with a Warm Welcome, made sure breakfast was perfect (Which it was). He did this with everyone. His smile was effervescent and contagious. I was amazed at his wonderful disposition especially at 7 am. Amazing employee! I hope the IHG Hotel group puts him on a Hospitality Management Career path. The breakfast food was delicious and the variety outstanding.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed four nights here .the room was clean and comfortable got a free breakfast not much choice but it was nice coffee and tea and water facilities for during the day the staff were very helpful and friendly Was in walking distance for most attractions

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Holiday Inn isn't necessarily very glamourous and I was kind of disappointed when I learned I was going to stay there on a business travel... but then I arrived and the staff & service were so dedicated, helpful and nice that my stay was made much better. If you like being welcomed as a friend, helped with everything you need as if you're staying at some prestigious hotel, being smiled at and greeted all the time by everybody, and feeling as if every staff member is actually doing their dream job by serving you, then that's the right place. Amazing service from: Juan, Richard, Farrell, MariaCarmen.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: What a fantastic hotel! Love the location, 10 minutes walk from Times Square and a lot of other top spots very nearby-Central Park, 5th Avenue, Madison Square Garden etc. The free breakfast is great, plenty of hot & cold choices. It does get busy at breakfast so please be prepared to wait for a table but only 5 minutes or so. Matthew on reception is lovely, very friendly and helpful. Look out for Farrell at breakfast, what a top bloke! Always has a smile on his face and got my days off to a great start! The beds are so comfortable and the rooms are clean although those with two Queen size beds are a little small. However if you're out exploring all day, space in the bedroom is irrelevant as you'll only be using it to sleep in! Overall a great hotel. I'd definitely stay here again and if you're happy with a budget hotel this is the best and I'd recommend it!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I'm just back from NYC and stayed here for 4 nights with my sister, mum and aunt. The hotel was in a great location and only a 10 minute walk from Times Square. the room was great and very clean. I would like to say a big thank you to Richard at the reception! He was so welcoming and extremely helpful. We were slightly early for check-in so our room wasn't ready, but we were able to help ourselves to complimentary tea and coffee while we waited. The purpose of the trip was because it was my sisters 21st birthday and I mentioned this to Richard when we were checking in. The second day there was a bottle of wine, a card and a photo frame was put in our room to say happy birthday. I thought this was a lovely gesture from the hotel. The breakfast was also great and had a wide variety of foods. I would definitely stay here again!!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed at this hotel just for one night by myself. The room was large, clean and comfortable overall. On the ground floor and in front of the reception, there is cafeteria and coffee, tea and water are available for 24 hours, which was convenient for myself who go out from and come back to the hotel several times in a day. This hotel would be a good performance on cost for business use.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: First visit to NY with the family.We all loved our stay at this HIX.10/15 min walk to times square.Great breakfast included.Varied every day,hot & cold options available.Does get full but go early.Will defiantly be back.In In All Great Value.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Front Desk Staff is friendly. Very nice & very humorous, though apparently, ineffective. Housekeeping is,however, wrecking our stay. First day, they took the used soap & shampoo from our shower & replaced it with NOTHING. When we inquired for more at the Front Desk, they replied with "We'll send some up in a bit." We explained that we needed it NOW as we had to get ready to go to the theatre NOW. A young man showed up at our door 30 minutes later with FOUR small bottles of shampoo (ONLY! ...NO soap!) Before we left our room, we noticed that they had also failed to replace our "in-suite coffee" packs. So after we returned from the theatre that evening, we once again went to the desk to ask for our missing "replacements". Again, we were told "We'll send it right up" (even though we were preparing to go to bed & it was late.) It never came. It's now 8:40 a,m,, & we'll now have to shower with SHAMPOO & have NO coffee! There service at this place is HORRIBLE! All I can give highest marks for are the airconditioning.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: First, an especially big Thanks to Ashley at Reception - although our 2 rooms weren't ready when we arrived, Ashley completed the checkin so when we returned late that evening - we just picked up the keys and went to our rooms. She also requested they be on the same floor (which we had hoped for). 2) Big Thanks to Luis - he upgraded both our rooms to the 10th floor - a really big bonus to me as my one request was a quiet room. The room was very clean & although not huge (typical of NYC) had everything you could need and especially a VERY comfortable bed and pillows. Everyone at the hotel was friendly, informative and tried their best to help with all our questions or requests. One very useful tip came from Matthew at the front desk when we were leaving for the airport. We took a cab to Penn Station and he said to ask the driver to go along 11th Avenue first - thereby avoiding a ton of traffic so saving us extra cab fare! Thanks to Matthew! The breakfast area was crowded each day but food was replaced almost the moment the platters became empty and we sat outside in the nice patio area. Good start to the day! John also helped with questions and service. There are simply too many people to Thank!! What a treat to be able to say that. It's about a 10 min. walk to the nearest subway or 15-20 min. to Times Square - this is the only reason I've given 4** not 5** rating. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed at this hotel in August for 3 nights prior to leaving the city on a cruise. The hotel is well located, a few minutes walk from Broadway, but also walkable to 5th Avenue and Central Park as it's located on 48th street. We chose this hotel as it's only two blocks away from the main cruise terminal,that for us meant we saved on another cab fare. The hotel is located on 48th street, about a 45min cab ride from JFK that cost $65 but for $75 the hotel arranged a town car. The hotel itself is clean and basic, it was full when we were there but very minimal noise throughout the night, complimentary breakfast is of good choices which is served in the main reception area, with coffee available all day. The rooms were clean, we had two double beds with a good size shower and for once the shower was both powerful and hot. The staff were superb and although the hotel does not offer day rooms they allowed us to store our bags on the return from our cruise at no extra charge before flying out of JFK that evening.Other facilities included a small but reasonable gym and nice patio area at the front of the hotel. Well worth it, highly recommended. The local area felt safe, on each night we walked back from the main attractions and not once felt uncomfortable.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We had a total of 5 rooms for a total of 16 people over the course of Labor Day weekend. The rooms are small but clean and I found the bed to be very comfortable. They have two types of pillows (firm and soft) designated by their pillow case which was a nice touch. Some bathrooms have a tub, mine just a shower stall which was fine for me. Breakfast was comprehensive with eggs (scrambled or hard boiled), cereal or oatmeal, yogurt, a pancake machine, waffles, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, toast, bagels or english muffin, a juice station and coffee station. They do a lot with a little bit of space. The entire staff was very friendly and seemed genuinely happy to see you. Their seating area would sometimes be very busy but they had quite a few staff members cleaning tables for the turnover. The elevators were slow at times. The patio area had some very comfortable furniture and was a nice place to hang out. They held our bags after checkout and were very accommodating. This place was a few long blocks from the nearest subway. Times square was about 4 long blocks away. There were some restaurants in easy walking distance. We picked this place because the price was better than any other place we could find. Overall a really good experience.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: These are the times i sometimes say to lady desk clerks honey i am home it was a great pleasurethey knew the area well gave me precise directions was real nice breakfast enjoyed every moment in the hotel everyone treated you like family from managers to yard keepers the felt as though the opened there own house up for you here cant wait to come back Thank you.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: NOT bad location, so walkable to the main sites.Few minutes away from W50th St subway station, with easy access to JFK via line E and the AIRTRAIN from Sulphin/Jamaica...We were kindly upgraded from a queen to a king high up with a great skyline view...Small rooms for the US but all you need.Breakfast very American and not good for the waistline, but you are walking it off on Manhattan any way...Shame about the polystyrene plates and plastic knives and forks, but they seem limited for space, so will let pass!! Coffee and tea etc available in lobby all time.Americans are so friendly & polite..The staff throughout are wonderful...WE could learn a lot from them in that regard...All in all very happy with this choice...WAS 100% Avios and did drain our total somewhat but is NEW YORK CITY!!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Staff was fine and helpful. We aren't high maintenance so when we had to deal with them which wasn't often, our experience was great. You can't get a lobby patio in many hotels in Manhattan. Rooms are tight with 4 people in them but managable. Was pleasantly surprised with breakfast! No complaints! Location is two long NYC blocks from subway which made for some whiny kids and parents at the end of the day! Safe neighborhood, so many food options around in Hell's Kitchen. The only reason I wouldn't stay here again is that the location, a bit of a walk to subway and Times Square, but that certainly isn't a reflection on the holiday inn chain of hotels.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We had a very unpleasant stay at this hotel. We booked this hotel for 2 nights on our Manhattan visit. We simply booked this rate, of being close to Times Square, although paying a hefty price of approx $200 per night, just because of the proximity to the New York's attractions.After a very tiring day- when asked for Drinking water at front desk at 12 in the night, receptionist refused to give water- saying- "Hotel is out of stock of Drinking Water" , and asked me to buy from the vending machine. All vending machines in hotel were out of water, and instead took my money- and neither returned money and nor gave water. Hotel staff refused to give water, and finally we along with 1 more guest had an arguement with Receptionist in the night- just to get 1 water drinking bottle. Its very unfortunate and pity of this hotel, to refuse Drinking water, the bare minimum need and requirement for life, that too at the middle of night by saying lies- that we are out of water. Feel pity and disgusted at the hotel, you guys are charging so much for single night, and can't even provide Drinking water, and that too to someone when someone is in need in the middle of night.I cannot believe, how can such a big hotel be out of stock of Drinking water. Don't they have a single water filter installed to offer some filtered water- if these guys feel miser in offering waterDisgusted, and will always avoid to stay in holiday inn . Chain of Marriott hotels is much better, at least -they don't refuse water . Felt disgusted and unsatisfied with the hotel.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Nice hotel, large rooms, not new but clean. In New York you don't stay at the hotel. We are satisfied. Our children got the room at 17th floor with a very nice view.But Wi-Fy sucs. I needed to get some work done, but nor in the room or in the reception is it good enough. Will come back when your have better coverage.ThanksPer and Solveig

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This is a great value hotel in Manhattan. The Metro is about 2 blocks away but within walking distance. The hotel is located in the centre of Hells Kitchen as a consequence there is never a dearth of good cuisine to sample. You can also order in as most restaurants will deliver to the hotel as we discovered to our utter delight. The rooms are a bit small in this newly furbished and launched property; but you cant expect more in Manhattan! And yet they are fully equipped. The front office reception and the breakfast crew are absolutely incredible. Always polite, helpful, willing to go the extra mile and smiling. The breakfast is more than adequate and always refilled despite the steady inflow of guests that come in and stock up for the day. We spent a very pleasant 11-12 nights at this hotel and apart from the clumsy and perhaps careless housekeeping staff (beds were never made properly, cleaning was inadequate and the room never looked sanitized) the stay was both comfortable and pleasant. We would happily stay here again as the hospitality exuded would win most people over.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I've only given this very good purely because the buffet breakfast area is just too small to cope with the amount of guests staying when at capacity. We struggled to find anywhere to sit either inside or out on at least three mornings, but I have to praise Farrell, who did everything he could to help us and deserves a special mention. All the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and spacious, but one other observation ... we were downstairs on the floor below the lobby. There are no stairs down to that floor so sometimes we'd wait ages for one of the two lifts and if they were going up, we'd wait even longer. There are stairs up but signs are there asking you not to use them unless in an emergency. The maintenance manager did escort us up on a couple of occasions though as we'd been waiting so long for the lifts. I'd recommend this hotel as it's in a pretty central location. We were able to walk to most places from 48th.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff at this hotel was very pleasant and helpful. I'd like to point out a few of the people that impressed me - Luis, Richard, Gaby and Matthew. There were countless others that contributed to a wonderful stay. Hotel was very clean and well maintained. Best deal in the Hell's Kitchen area.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I'll start with the breakfast. It's very nice to start the day with such a breakfast. The articles are fresh, carefully attended to, and above all - free. Farell, the breakfast attendant, was professional, helpful and pleasant, even during stressful minutes. The hotel's location very good and is within walking distance from many restaurants and attractions including Times Square and Broadway theatres.Kelley from the reception was helpful and informative. During weekdays, the construction site across the street will not allow a late morning sleep. for us it didn't matter but if you're a late bloomer...

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: A very good hotel not far from Times Square. Some great little restaurants/bars in the area nearby. Stayed in a room with 2 double beds, a little small but certainly manageable. Plentiful breakfast options. Very helpful & efficient staff.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I like to bond with people, and the staff at this property were fun. The desk clerk, Matthew, has a space heater behind the desk, even though it is the middle of the summer. I have nick named him "Delicate Flower". When you visit, you should ask to speak to Delicate Flower. I'm hoping the name will stick.The rooms are small, which is typical for this class of hotel in the city. They have the traditional Holiday Inn Express breakfast (eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, yogurt, etc.) . It is a four block walk to Times Square, but these are avenue blocks, and it slightly up hill, so it isn't really just outside your door. However, it is still convenient, so long as everyone in your group is fully ambulatory. This part of the island has historically been reserved for car dealers, horse stables and auto body shops. It is in transition, and as such is more tourist friendly. It is still Hell's Kitchen, but it isn't as rough as it once was.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We had a great stay at the Holiday Inn Express. This hotel will be my "go to" place for my future NYC vacations. This hotel is located in the "Hell's Kitchen" area of NYC, so it is surrounded by fun and trendy restaurants in every price range. It is about a half mile walk to the closest subway station and just shy of 1 mile walk to Times Square. If you need wash & fold laundry services, there are 2 laundry places (self-serve & wash&fold) open late within 2 blocks. We went to Laundry Cafe and got same day service on 12 pound bag of laundry for $15. Note: This is NYC, do not expect to get a quiet room. As most other reviewers noted, this is a new hotel with WiFi and breakfast included. Breakfast is awesome and the staff is extremely helpful and courteous.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: On our arrival we were greeted at reception in the morning by Richard.. Very nice gentleman who is as cute as a bear! Anyways the room was not ready but we stored our bags and he helped us plan our entire trip! Gave us free waters and sent us on our way.. The breakfast was good and this young lady Gaby was very nice to us there and helpful at the reception with Richard we don't think he ever leave hotel always smiling. Please give regards to them both our journey only 4 days in the big city but next time we stay much longer.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel was selected for its proximity to times square, about a 10 minute walk, and the price offered. The overall experience was good. The room was of reasonable size for the family of 3, though it was smaller than what it looked online. The breakfast was part of the room package - it is a decent spread; although, due to the holiday season, there was a huge rush at the small breakfast area. Wifi was also free, and was quite strong in the rooms and the lobby. Service also was good.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I booked this hotel for my friend and I for 3 days prior to a cruise.(It was a referral by the travel company) Besides the small room space, my only complaint was a major security breach. On the 2nd day of our stay, another person was coming into town and staying with us in our room. My friend and I I went out. And the additional person arrived at the hotel before we made it back. She was NOT anywhere on the reservation. And I did not even mention to the front deskperson that there would be another person staying in the room. The additional person wentto the front desk, told the attendant that she was staying in my room and the front deskperson gave her a key to the room. She was already inside when my friend and Ireturned. The additional person's name was nowhere on the reservation. I had to show ID upon check in. Obviously, she did not show ID. They did not have her name. How was she allowed a key just by stating that she was staying with me? The hotel did not even call, text or email me to ask if this person was, in fact, legit. I feel this was a complete breach of security on the hotel’s part. Luckily, the person given a key was not a complete stranger. But, the hotel staff did not know that. So, technically, they did give a stranger a key to my room without my knowledge. I believe this is unacceptable. I don’t understand why anyone is given a keyto a room without proper identification. If the wrong person was given a key, I hate to think what could’ve happened when my friend and I walked into that room. I understand thatit did not, but my mind can’t help but wander to the ‘what if’. My peace of mind, when traveling, has been damaged. And for that reason, I will never stay at any of the InterContinental Hotels Group properties again. I can’t afford to gamble with my safety...

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We spent three nights at the hotel. Loved the location- 3 blocks from Times Square and walking distance to many attractions. The hotel was clean and the complimentary breakfast was excellent. 3 of the 4 of us are gluten free (celiac). Farrell (breakfast staffer extraordinaire) noticed my sister eating her baggie of chex cereal and asked if she was gf. He then proceeded to tell us about the gf waffles, bagels, english muffins and cereal that are all available upon request. Fabulous! We really appreciated his attention to detail and personal touch. Thanks Farrell.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: As a frequent guest at Holiday Inn Express I was very excited to find a unit located in Midtown Manhattan. Not begin familiar with the area I was ecstatic at finding the location was just three blocks from Time Square and within walking distance to most of the theaters. The hotel was very busy during our stay and the staff was very accommodating working hard to see everyone had a great stay. Rooms in this location are a bit smaller when compared to other Holiday Inn Express locations but when visiting New York do you really want to stay in your room?? With everything from Central Park (10 blocks) to 42nd Street (6 blocks) to the Hudson River (3 blocks) this location is a perfect spot for the visitor on a budget. The only challenge we encountered was during breakfast due to the morning rush of our fellow travelers. Perhaps if we had gotten up and out a little earlier things would have been different but a bigger breakfast area would have also helped.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff were always friendly, helpful and knowledgeable, always greeting you with a smile and a polite hello. For a mid-priced hotel you certainly got value for money. Room cleanliness was of a high standard. Ideal location. Many of New York’s sites within walking distance, including Times Square, the Rockefeller Centre, Broadways theatre district. The hotel is a stones throw from the area called "Hells Kitchen", so a good variety of different cuisines to savour.Only one negative to our stay was the rat race at breakfast time. When full the hotel only has a relatively small breakfast area, resulting in guests having to stand and wait for a table to become free. Tip here is to arrive before 08:00hrs or after 09:00hrs to avoid the peak time. The breakfast itself is good serving a wide range of hot and cold food.Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to any visitor to New York.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We wanted a reasonably priced hotel for a couple of nights and booked this on the strength of the trip advisor reviews. We found the hotel very clean and comfortable and the breakfasts very good. The thing that made our stay great was the quality of the staff. They were excellent and nothing was too much trouble for them especially Farrell who served at breakfast.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This is a great hotel with terrific staff. Every staff person I talked to was helpful and friendly. My traveling group experienced a great 'girls trip'. The rooms were classic New York small, but the spaces were used wisely. The patio in the front of the hotel was a wonderful place to sit and visit both at the beginning and the end of the days adventure in New York City!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We picked this place to be near the Intrepid pier, and it suited us perfectly for that. Intrepid was just a short walk away. Times Square and theater district are a few blocks away - walkable. Rooms are a modest size but clean and comfortable. One quibble with the service: we had the "do not disturb" sign on our door until about 11. We got back around 2 and the room had not been serviced, which surprised us. We called in the afternoon - maybe 5pm to make sure the room had been serviced. The person who answered seemed more interested in proving to us that the "do not disturb" sign had been on the door during regular service hours than in making sure the room was ready for us when we returned. It should have been a simple conversation: "We'll take care of it."

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed here for two nights while I was taking a short course at a local university. The hotel was clean and the staff were helpful and friendly. My room was also clean and had what I needed, although it was small and faced a brick wall (which I'd known ahead of time and didn't care about). It was relatively quiet. The downside is that this section of 48th Street is dirty - lots of garbage (some bagged, but lots unbagged - just thrown into a huge pile), which smelled and looked awful. I felt a bit uncomfortable walking the block by myself at night (I am female) so I took a cab back. Not the hotel's fault, but the city needs to clean up this block. I wouldn't go back because of it.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My friend and I stayed overnight after returning from a short cruise and another friend joined us later. It was a short walk from Pier 88 and we could still see the ship from our window. It was a tight squeeze for 3 people with not much room to walk round the room. It was ok given we were only staying the one night. Staff were great and we were able to check in early and they held our bags after we checked out while we went sightseeing. Breakfast was fine.The only down side was building going on across the road - very noisy!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed here for an overnight in NYC after returning from a cruise. It was a short walk to the hotel from Pier 88 and we could even see our ship from the window! Rooms are small there were three of us but it was ok, staff was great and helpful, and the breakfast was fine.The hotel let us check in early and held our bags after check out while we went sightseeingOnly con is currently they are building across the street the noise is horrendous...

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We went as a family of nine people ages 70 down to 11 years of age. We were there for four nights and found the location was great for us to walk most places we were interested in going to. The rooms were not large but nice and kept very clean. The beds were very comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet. The staff was very helpful and friendly helping us with directions etc. The breakfast room was large with a great variety of food which the staff kept well stocked and fresh. The breakfast room staff were all very pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Despite the rooms being really small, the customer service and the kindness of the hotel staff makes this hotel a must stay. The breakfast was great and fresh every morning, one of the best full service breakfast I've had in a while. I loved my stay there and the young man John who worked the breakfast area was totally awesome. He was great and showed a great deal of love for his job. Will most def stay there again. Not to mention an excellent location.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Have stayed at this site two years in a row. Well kept property, small rooms, but the location makes up for it. Easy walking distance to the theaters and there are many restaurants near the hotel. Staff very helpful in reserving transportation to the airport. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed with my kids for three days and found this place to be excellent compared to the other hotels I stayed in in the past. The rooms are a bit tight for 2+ people, but the location is great, the reception, dining area, corridors and rooms are very clean and well organized. The staff is amazing from front desk all the way to room cleaning. Breakfast is generous, with wide range of varieties. The smile and continuous assistance of the staff at breafast time are exceptional and contagious. I would definitely come again in the near future. The only thing I would change is to make half of the outside seats non-smoker. It is unfortunate that there is no single corner for non-smoking customers and kids. Also, the fact that by-standers on the side walk smoke makes the terrace unfriendly to families with little kids.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My husband and I have stayed at this property before and chose it this time because it was convenient to the Javitz convention center where we had to be. On our down time, we were within walking distance to everything we needed. And with this being a walking city, we were able to find our way with a little help from our smart phone directions. We were able to walk to the theatre, Times Square, Rock Center and shopping. The rooms are a tad small, but for NYC, it was expected, as they tend to utilize every inch of space in the city. The customer service at this property is so accommodating. The breakfast makes the value here incredible and special mentions to Farrell. Most of the time when you're at the free hotel breakfast, the staff just does what they have to do and goes about their business. NOT Farrell. We had such a nice conversation with him and he was as pleasant and as helpful as could be. A valuable employee like that can make or break your trip (and your review!).The only reason I did not give the hotel 5 stars was the air conditioner. While it works very well, It would go on every 5 minutes and that's a bit annoying when you're trying to sleep.Thanks, Farrell and thanks HI Express for a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Had a wonderful stay for 6 nights at this hotel. The only observation is that the room was a little bit small, but this is understandable as being in New York. Other than this the room was always kept clean. The bed and pillows were wonderful, definitely had a good nights sleep every night. The staff were always friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was also always good. The location is walking distance to Time Square. Would recommend is hotel.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: When my travel agent suggested this hotel I was very skeptical, as I had read some of the reviews and I was worried about the neighbourhood! I booked anyway and a few weeks later considered loosing my weeks payed accom to go somewhere else! But I'm glad we didn't!! The neighbourhood LOOKS a little sketchy but it was safe for us!! And i normally freak out over everything! The room was massive!!! Very clean! Hugh breakfast! And free wifi.. I'm not sure of the breakfast attendants name but he really really loves his job! What a beautiful friendly man! Always smiling and greeting everyone! I absolutely lives the ice cold drinks and cookies in the late afternoon ( offered free in the lobby) and trust me it's needed after your loong walks around New York in the heat! We absolutely loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone! Thank you guys!!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The breakfast was AMAZING. Farrell and the staff were so accommodating and helpful, and really went out of their way to provide the best experience for their guests. There was also a nice seating area outside the hotel where we could enjoy our breakfast. The location was near major subways, Central Park and broadway, but was located on a quieter street. The staff was amazing and I would recommend a stay here to anyone.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed here while visiting NYC. We were all very pleased with the location, close to the things we wanted to see, like Times Square, but removed so it was kind of neighborhood-like. The service here was great. The desk attendants were very friendly and knowledgeable and actually offered assistance. We had a nice room on a top floor and when you looked out the window to the right you could see the Hudson River! The downstairs lobby area was inviting and we congregated down there frequently. We really appreciate that there were two computers in the lobby. The breakfast was great and the attendants were really on the ball. Guess they have to be with such a high volume. You are also able to sit outside which doesn't happen all the time. We all liked this hotel better than the HI on 57th Street that we stayed at last year. You will like this hotel. We were prepared for some street noise based on other reviews we saw, but there was virtually none!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Rooms were very tidy, although with 2 double beds a bit crammed. But still very good value for money. Special thanks to Farrell, who was very warm, polite, and took care of breakfast tables like a superhuman, and to Alex L, very nice guy who took care of our luggage while we were out on the town for few hours after checking out....

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: What a wonderful experience from the very first second. My husband and I spent 5 nights there and could not be more pleased with our experience. The staff was outstanding. Friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. The location is perfect - walking distance to Times Square. Breakfast was amazing every morning. We would stay again in a heartbeat. (Yes, there is construction going on across the street, but it was never a problem for us. We were on the 11th floor of that side of the building, but who visits NYC to stay in their hotel room through the day???)Our stay was terrific !

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I'm an avid IHG Group hotel customer. This hotel was everything you would expect expect from good customer service, comfy beds, clean rooms, updates, in room coffee and fast wifi. The only grumble I would have, and honestly I don't think they can do anything about it, was that you had to elbow people for coffee and breakfast in the morning. There was no where to sit. I ate out instead. If you are staying here for pleasure, it's quiet but not too far off the tourist path. I highly recommended if you are working at the Javits, it's a short walk.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My husband and I plus a teenaged grandson just returned from 4 nights at this hotel. Many pluses were our experiences there. Friendly, warm staff, from front desk personnel to maintenance people and housekeeping. As has been noted before, rooms are smaller but well designed and with a little organization you can be comfortable. Breakfast can get crowded, but so many hotels do not offer you a complimentary breakfast that this is a perk that is well received. Most people enjoy their breakfast and move on so you can generally find a table. A HUGE benefit this hotel provides is the front patio type area with comfy chairs, tables etc. weather permitting, you can always enjoy your breakfast there.If you enjoy walking, the location is pretty accessible to West Side sights. Some complaints have been registered that the subway station is a "hike"...it IS...but here's a tip...you need only visit that subway station once, when you purchase your 7 day unlimited subway/bus MetroCard at the station. Once you have that MetroCard, from the hotel you can walk to 11th Avenue and north 2 short blocks to 50th street and catch the #50 bus crosstown and hook up with other bus lines which link you wherever you want to go. BIG TIP HERE...why do any tourists want to ride subways all the time. Get a MetroCard, get a bus map (or put it on your smartphone) and ride the buses...you see everything...no transfers needed, just the best way to view the attractions of the Big Apple. I would most definitely recommend this hotel...and would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Hotel was average. The only two people that actually made an impact on my stay were Kelly and Farrell. Kelly was super sweet at the front desk and attended to our needs promptly. It was a pleasure waking up to Farrell's flamboyant attitude ! and he remembered my name. One thing I clearly remember that hurt my overall experience is when asking for water at the front desk, a young man hesitated instead of promptly being welcoming and saying of course, even after it being my fourth night there. Another employee also lied about the hotel having extra packets of ketchup, or maybe he was unaware which is still bad. I know the hotel did carry extra packets because the pleasant young Farrell the next morning provided me with some for my breakfast !

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We went to NYC for the "Raisin in the Sun", Broadway Play on 47th and 7th at the Barrymore theatre. It was a nice 10 minute walk from HI Express at Manhattan West. The location is off the path yet within walking distance of everything in NYC, Time Sq, Heard Sq, all Subway stations and all the restaurants. The room was excellent small but that's NYC. Great Rates, Very clean and the Staff from House keeping to the Front Desk were excellent. Kelley and Matthew were always willing to assist. Matthew was very helpfully in providing directions and how to ride the subway (being a suburbanite myself). Kelley was a pro when it came to reserving transportation for myself and two Grand Children (7 & 11) to the airport. We really enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Express Manhattan West. Thank you Kelley and Matthew for being the most helpful and making our stay memorable.Loretta G Milton GA

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, traveled as a couple. I have only good things to say about this place. The guy who checked us is was very kind and friendly. The rooms are tinny but clean, ours was on the 9th floor with city view. We are very familiar with hotel rooms in big cities, so we expected the size and it didn't bother us at all. The interior is simple but new, same as the bathroom (had only shower). Free WiFi is also a huge plus! The entire property is quite new from the inside. The breakfast is OK, I mean it does the job and the fresh cinnamon rolls were really good. Be aware that if you come done towards the end of the breakfast (before 9:30am) it is really crowded there, but the staff handled it well and the food trays were always fool and were replaced really fast. Also, if it's a nice sunny day, there is s=an outdoor patio where you have your breakfast if the dining area is full. All an all, the entire staff was really great great, smiling and willing to help with everything.The only "thorns" I have on the hotel is the construction works right across the street that wake you up (we were jet-lagged anyway so it didn't bother us much) and the elevators are really slow and during the breakfast time to can spend quite a lot of time on waiting for one.The area is really nice, only 3 block from the subways station and also there are a lot of cute little places to eat and drink in this area of the Hell's Kitchen.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Spent 4 nights at this hotel and couldn't be more happy with our choice. All the staff were happy & helpful especially the breakfast staff. I love the pancake machine! Breakfast was plentiful but sometimes busy so had to share tables with others. Not a problem for us but may be for others. Room was large and had a wet-room which did flood a bit when we used the shower. Free wifi was fast and well used ;-) We were on the 10th floor at the rear and we had no trouble with outside noise however the air con vent in the corridor was noisy and we could hear it from inside our room. We were so tired from all the walking so it didn't affect our sleep! Overall would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to visit again one day.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: From the moment we stepped into the door we felt welcome! We were greeted by Richard and Luis and I don't think there was a single person that didn't smile or say good morning or good evening! Other hotels in this chain or even other chains could take lessons from all of the staff here! The Holiday Inn Express is across from the Salvation Army but this was not a problem. It was one and half (long ones not the short ones) blocks from the pier for cruise ships, the Intrepid Museum and the water taxi. Four (long ones again) blocks from Times Square. There are a number of restaurants in the area.I believe the hotel information says continental breakfast, this is a lie!!! It was a full breakfast with sausage, bacon, eggs, cereal, yogurt, toast, apples, bananas, oranges, pancakes, biscuits, gravy... Furell kept it fully stocked during our entire time and it was a busy place.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We just celebrated my 50th birthday in New York- and the staff at this hotel were outstanding. The hotel itself was clean, the beds were comfortable and the breakfast was great. But most of all, my family had a little "situation" on Saturday and the staff were so caring and compassionate- we really appreciated their support.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Went here last year in June - it was an awful week to be in NYC because it rained throughout my whole stay. For those not familiar with NYC, the walk in the rain from 11th Ave towards 8th and 7th doesn't look that far on the map, but it far when you are walking in the rain. Yes there are buses that go across the city but not frequently enough. Besides that if you are looking to hang out in Hell's Kitchen this is the perfect location. Lots of great little cafes and restaurants in the area. But a further than desirable walk to all the typical tourist attractions. The hotel itself is new, therefore the decor and washroom were updated. When I say it was great value the price was great, but there are small details that didn't give this place a higher rating. The walls and doors are thin. I could hear my neighbours coming home and also could hear them through the walls. The cleaning staff would forget some of their cleaning tools in my room, one time it was a feather duster, another time it was a dust rag. They didn't fill in my coffee station everyday. The front reception staff were very helpful and courteous, but it did seem that the staff were all new and not at a certain level of professionalism that only experience would be able to fix.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This HIE is a great value and the location is great. You can easily walk to Time Square, Broadway and all the theaters. The room size is generous for a Manhattan hotel and the breakfast is a step above most free hotel offerings. My room was very clean, the furnishings were new and the staff was freindly.
user_name:
Scott S
Camana Bay, Grand Cayman

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed here because the price value for a mid town Manhattan hotel was excellent. However most other things are average at best. As a platinum IHG member I was told I was upgraded to a larger room. That room was very small. I'd hate to see how small the other rooms are. Worse than being small was the room was directly behind the elavotor shaft on one on the higher floors. Everytime the elevator would move the sound in my room was very annoying. I'm not sure what there cleanliness standard is but I was there for three nights and the room was never vacuumed. I minor spill of a nut mix was left on my floor every night. This was quite discomforting as I'm sure this lack of attention is happening elsewhere in the room and property. Lack of cleanliness is a sure way to get a bad review.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My husband and I booked this last minute through Hotwire so there's always a fear of what the trade off is for the great rate. We were both pleasantly surprised by every aspect of this lovely hotel. The rooms were actually much larger than others I have stayed at in midtown Manhattan This is clearly a fairly new hotel and the decor of the room was reflective of this. It was spotless which is key for me to feel at ease. Over the weekend there was a club pumping out loud music bothFriday and Saturday which had me reaching for the earplugs but this was certainly not any fault of the hotel. I love a hotel that offers a hot breakfast and have stayed at other HIE's in California for this feature alone. It saves not only money but precious time. Breakfast was always fresh and plentiful however prepare to wait for tables to free up and to stand in line for food. We were on the go pretty early and it was always full. Patience is a must. I give mad props to the breakfast attendants - especially Farrell who despite the madness always had a sunny disposition and tried to ensure you had what you needed. In fact all of the staff were notably friendly and accommodating. They really can set the tone of your stay. This hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from Times Sq- which we didn't really mind but some might. Restaurant row is close as are other fabulous restaurants. I would definitely return and happily recommend.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I was very happy with this hotel. It's a short walk to Javits and Times Square, close to some great restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. The employees were helpful and the buffet exceeded my expectations. The buffet was always crowded, but if the weather is nice you can eat outside on the large patio. The first night were were woken up early by construction. Thankfully, we were able to move to the back of the hotel for the rest of our stay. If you can request those rooms ahead of time I would, they have much better view too. Also, after the move a lengthy hand-written letter (with candy!) was delivered to our room, apologizing for the noise. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: After researching and reading reviews, I decided to book my vacation on December in this hotel. It was a real surpise. I had asked for 2 beds, and though via phone they said they couldn't promise to deliver my request, they did. It's a good distance from Times Square and the nearest subway station is around 4 blocks but what I paid it's worth it. The room is small, but comfortable. The value for my money was worth it.The staff is very friendly and helps on any request. Only "issue" was our room wasn't ready on time, but we could wait on the lobby.If you travel on winter season and want to walk to your sites, be careful, snow is tricky. On the hotel they have service that can hook you up with transportation.Thanks to all the staff.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Location : The Hotel is Excellently locacted in the 48th street between 10th Ave and 11th Ave...which makes it 15-min-walk away from Time SquRe; Main Bust Terminal and to 7th Ave in General as a main shopping street...its a bit far from the Famous 5th Ave..but u can still walk it if u r a "Walking Person"...Location is Excellent. ..betterocation botels would be much mkre expensive...Cleanliness:the room was OK...not very ean nor very dirty..but it was not the best room I have ever been in Cleanliness....especially carpets and bed linen. ...but I didnt spend much at the room so it didnt irrktate me that much....yet u must not expect the cleanest of hotels when u drop by there...The Hotel Staff:They r the 2nd best thing after the location...friendly; helpfull and smiley...Value for Money:You can easily find a non-Branded Hotel nearby with much lower prices...my advice is to check all the areas for other botels...you woukd find non famous hotels with less prices and same level of cleanliness...all on 48th and 49th street may be...just che k all your options and not go for the botel name u know...it isnt cheap and it isnt WoW..so why not explore other options....ROOMS ARE VERY VERY SMALL...I guess this is what "Express" Means....but it was Too small...just giving you a heads up..

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel as a rule is quite pleasant except for a few minor things. The breakfast is ok if you can get seated but we really struggled and as a result ate out a couple of times. The lifts are not worth bothering with they take forever. The staff are pleasant and rooms are clean except a little basic.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We greeted by Richard on reception on arrival, a larger than life character who was a gem, very knowledgable and made us feel as ease immediately. Although we arrived early our room was available for us. The room was clean and well appointed. The hotels location was great, in a quieter neighbourhood not far from Times Square, the Sea Air and Space Museum and the Port Authority Bus Terminal. Breakfast was excellent, a great supply and large selection. My advice would be to get to breakfast early (6.30) as the room is not huge. Altogether an excellent hotel which I would definitely visit again. all staff were friendly.free wifi was a huge bonus and greatly appreciated

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The service was outstanding, genuine customer service. Rooms are clean and fresh, small but it is Manhattan. Superfast wifi and sat TV!!! Breakfast was good and food was constantly being refilled/replaced. The breakfast area was somewhat crowded due to a high influx of tourist.Kelley at the front desk really worked hard making sure our check-in and check-out was done right (we had five rooms). She is friendly and had a lot of patience.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights. The room was well appointed and the buffet breakfast was plentiful. The staff did their best to make our stay a pleasant one. The hotel is operating at full capacity most of the time.The only downside was the slow elevators. We also found the location a little far to walk as it is not on a major bus route and at least 10 minutes away from the nearest subway station.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights while visiting the City and I have to stay this was a surprise gem of a hotel! Clean, Comfortable and a room size that is considered spacious in NYC we couldn't have asked for more. Staff were super friendly and helpful and there is free computer access for checking in and printing boarding cards etc. We didn't try breakfast but it seemed to go down well with other guests. Short walk to Times Square and as it is slap bang in the restaurant district of the city you won't be short of places to eat - would def recommend and stay again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our five night stay at this gem of a hotel just a ten minute stroll from Times Square or around six dollars in a cab for the less able. All the staff were most polite and extremely helpful throughout our stay. Our room was perfectly adequate in both size and facilities. Our bed was superb, as good as any we've slept in at four and even five star hotels. Our room was at the rear so we had no problems sleeping off the jet lag! Yes breakfast is a bit scramble for the late comers, but the selection is fine and I was lucky enough to savour the delicious cinnamon rolls on each morning of our stay. There are several good bars and diners nearby and I can recommend Gossip Irish Bar (49th and 9th) for a warm welcome and some tasty and hearty food. So despite the nearby construction works we really liked our stay in Hells Kitchen and will definitely pick this Holiday Inn Express on our next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I have to be honest, this wasn't my first hotel of choice but, the place I usually stay at, were obviously too busy ramping their rates up to respond to my e-mail re booking with them!! This was a last minute trip so after doing a little bit of research on this site I booked and hoped for the best - I wasn't disappointed. The room was HUGE (I've payed twice as much and got far smaller rooms at other hotels in Manhattan) and, being on the 17th floor, the view was awesome. The bathroom is very small but, quite frankly, I'm not too bothered by that; the shower was good and there was a fully functioning loo - job done!! Location wise you are a couple of blocks from Columbus Circle and also 7th Ave subway stops so you're really a 10 minute walk from getting anywhere in the city. I didn't eat at the restaurant or bar so I can't comment there. The staff I did have contact with (front desk & baggage room) were excellent, they really did go out of their way to help in any way they could - and this is why I will now be using this hotel for all future trips to New York.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: As an IHG member, I have stayed in many Holiday inn locations. I picked this hotel partly as a result of other reviews and the hotel's location. I had one free night and payed for one night. The guest rooms and bathrooms are on the small side but not unusual for NYC. The staff was pleasant. We were warned that if we went to breakfast on the late side (9 AM) that it would be crowded and it was. If it is warm enough, there are many tables outside but with temperatures in the 40s, the breakfast room was just packed. I also must note that the one thing that I look forward to at a Holiday Inn Express breakfast in the cinnamon rolls. They are even featured on a sign on each table. Sadly however, there were no rolls available at either the 9 AM breakfast on the first day or our 6:30 breakfast on the second day. Disappointing!The hotel is located on a primarily residential street. Our room was on the back side of the hotel so it was nice and quiet. There is a lot of construction on the street however so I am not sure how the front rooms fared. The construction made the sidewalks hard to navigate especially with luggage. I found hotel just a little too far from the subway for my needs. I would probably stay closer to the Theater District on my next visit.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I enjoyed my 5 nights staying. The staff is willing to serve. Rooms are clean and comfortble. Good location in terms of transportation. Very much recomended. Do try this hotel when ever you are in the big apple. Aviva Haleva, Israel.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff are very polite, friendly and helpful. And if based on that alone I'd give 5 stars overall. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable.However. I admit I'm light sleeper but you'd have to be knocked out to not wake up from the noise. There was an ice machine around the corner from our room that would make a loud crunching noise at the most ungodly hours throughout the night. Secondly even though we were on the 9th floor we were unfortunate enough to be here during major major building works which include drilling hammering etc at the highest volume I've ever heard from 7am onwards.In spite of this I would recommend this hotel if you could get away from the ice machine and all the building work has been done or they get double glazing!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: When we were arrived we were immediately greeted by the friendliest staff which set the tone for our entire stay. They were super helpful and made suggestions on how to get to the places we want to see and where to eat. They assisted us to our room, which was small but incredibly clean! That evening when we arrived back we were greeted by name by then staff, who asked us how our night was and if we needed anything. The next morning we went downstairs and were pleasantly surprised that our free breakfast was hot and delicious. We had a larger party and they secured us tables and moved them together for us. The staff was very willing to go above and beyond to ensure you enjoy your stay, the rooms are clean and comfortable. It was overall a great stay!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My sister, her husband and I booked the hotel for one night. In out check-in we booked a taxi to take us to the airport the next day on the front desk, but the attendant didn't contact the taxi company and the car didn't show up. The hotel stuff didn't give us any support and we had to get a yellow cab on the street. At night my brother-in-law and I went to the public computers to print our boarding ticket and he forgot the cell phone on the desk. He realized just the time he got in our room and when he went back to the computer, the cell phone was missing. It was really late at night and there was not many people around, the security guard was there but we couldn't find it. The next day the security manager couldn't help us much and the cell phone was stolen in the hotel.We will never stay in this hotel again.
user_name:
Sueli_Norie
Sao Bernardo Do Campo, SP

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff was very nice and very friendly. Breakfast was beyond crowded and just average. The room was so small we could not sit at the desk or move around at all. Construction was outside at 9 am on Saturday.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I was the group planner for a school group going on Spring Break. The pros: Great location, good, hot breakfast included in cost of room, and very friendly staff. The rooms were small, but that is to be expected anywhere in NYC. They were very clean and functional. The cons: The bathroom in my room (1006) had this crazy loud, random sound that would wake me up every hour or so. I couldn't figure it out but I didn't sleep well the first night at all. Our last night there, it sounded like a huge fight or large group of partiers parked outside our hotel and were really loud around midnight. We were on the 10th floor and I can only imagine what the lower levels heard. But overall, the pros outweighed the cons. We are already discussing next year's trip, and I won't hesitate to book this hotel again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Great hotel, great location, great facilities. In New York for a family wedding, the rooms were compact, but certainly adequate for 2 single adults. Wifi was reliable, breakfast was welcomed, however get down early when it's cold outside as the dining room can become overcrowded. During warmer months certainly wouldn't be a problem with adequate outdoor seating. Staff were very hospitable,within walking distance of Times Square and subway just several blocks away on 8th and 50th. The hotel was quite full and whilst there was some noise with school groups certainly nothing to worry about. At the end of a long day of walking, I would say the only small negative is that it was 3 blocks too far west as it is closet to 11th avenue....but don't let that out you off. All in all I would certainly stay there again when next in NYC!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: If you want a good night's sleep, find another hotel. You will be dealing with huge groups of teenagers who yell, knock, and are completely disrespectful at all hours of the night. Outside on their patio you will have loud, drunk, obnoxious guests who sit out there all night and keep you awake because the noise travels right up to the room (no insulation). This doesn't include the foot traffic going to bars and clubs who whistle, yell, and talk loudly all night long or the constant sirens, honking, fire trucks, and ambulances that may as well be going through your room. I did not sleep at all and a 3 night stay turned into a 1 night stay and I could not wait to check out first thing in the morning. When I checked out, they never even asked how my stay was or why I was leaving early. Another hotel guest at the desk was making similar complaints about the noise. Calling to the front desk through the night did nothing, they tried to tell me there was no noise outside. This hotel does not place any value on maintaining a quiet property and if you are a light sleeper, find another hotel. The neighborhood is pretty sketchy, too. Overall a terrible stay, one of the worst I have encountered.
user_name:
Ken G
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel is perfect! It is a new building! The staff was very friendly and spent much attention with the guests. The location of the hotel is privileged, just 3 blocks from Times Square (7 minutes walking). This is perfect, because you can relax and stay out of heavy traffic. The breakfast is also perfect, there is a great variety of foods and the staff is constantly in attention to replenish food. The room is extremely clean, new, the room service cleans it everyday, the bedroom is very confortable and there isn't any bedbug (which is very important, because this a potential problem is some hotels in New York, mainly in the old ones). There many goods options to lunch and dinner near from the hotel. There are many restaurants as: Italian, French, Portuguese, Bralizan, Thai, Chinese, and others. Still in the hotel, it is offered free internet connection (wi-fi) at the rooms and a complete service with computers and totems at the lobby. It is certain that in my next trip to New York my family and me will stay again on it.
user_location: Sao Jose Do Rio Preto, SP
user_name:
GeraldoZafalon
Sao Jose Do Rio Preto, SP

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Had a fantastic experience at this hotel. We felt most welcome from the time we entered the lobby. Great friendly staff, rooms extremely well presented and clean, all sports channels on the TV and a fantastic breakfast. Staff gave great advice and answered our questions before we even asked them. Location one block from Hells Kitchen restaurants was a real advantage too. Wished we had have stayed there longer......

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: A good hotel with clean rooms and good beds. The have free wifi that unfortunately is unstable. However, when I complained, they provided me with a cable and I was up and running. The follow up of my complaint was very good, they called me back to tell me what happened and afterwards to check if everything was OK.The breakfast is good, but it is a small breakfast room which is overcrowded all morning.I would consider using it again for a good offer

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel is in a perfect location. It is a short distance from Times Square and all other favourite New York City attractions. But, it is not in the middle of all the people and traffic which makes it a hotel that is perfect to relax in after a busy day touring the city. There was a variety of breakfast food and the counters were always stocked with food. The staff was very friendly too. The rooms, though they were on the small side, lacked no major amenity. The room was able to fit four people comfortably for three days. It was a great hotel and would definitely stay again on my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: One of the good things about picking a hotel in New York City is that you have a huge array of options. If you're someone who has $500 a night to burn on an old classic hotel with a gigantic lobby and rooms the size of a basketball court, there are other places where you can do that. But for what I needed on this trip, it is hard to imagine a better value than what I got. For openers, by New York standards the price was very, very reasonable. The room, while quite small, had an exceptionally comfortable bed, was immaculately clean (well, the outside windows were kind of dirty, but this is Manhattan), had an excellent TV with a fine choice of channels, good water pressure and hot water and overall very well maintained. The public areas, including the stairs, were very clean as well. It is true that the breakfast area was crowded, but I never was unable to get a seat, and I enjoyed the cinnamon rolls others have mentioned. The location is interesting: it's farther from restaurants and the subway than other Manhattan hotels where I've stayed, but within a 10 minute walk, you have plenty of choices. What's more, the neighborhood is astonishingly quiet and restful for Manhattan, and felt much safer and in better shape than I remembered Hell's Kitchen being. I was concerned about staying west of 7th Avenue, but I need not have been--the neighborhood is just fine. It's also a fine location for a walk to see a show (I walked right up 48th to the Walter Kerr Theater) or the Intrepid Museum. So for these reasons alone, the hotel would rate a strong review from me. What pushes it up to five circles was the service. I can't remember the last time I stayed at a hotel *anywhere* that had service this good. Staff remembered that I was there to see an NIT basketball game with my alma mater Minnesota at Madison Square Garden, and asked me later how the game went. Several of them remembered who I was, including the excellent housekeeper Fabiola. When there was a small plumbing problem in my room, it was fixed within 15 minutes. The manager who you see in the comments after other reviews was a regular presence at breakfast, checking up on how people were. They also gave me a room upgrade when I let them know I was in the Holiday Inn guest card program. I appreciate enthusiastic people who do a good job, whether it's in a hotel or somewhere else. This hotel has created a culture where the staff are committed to doing just that. I'd gladly stay there again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We had a very nice stay. Rooms are a little small, but it's not a problem in the city. We were central to every thing we wanted to see and visit. The staff was friendly and helpful. Even felt safe at night in the neighborhood.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Family weekend in NYC, 6 people.The hotel is located just a short walk from Times Square and is ideally placed.The staff were all extremely friendly and could not be more helpful, giving good advise on taxis, public transport and places to eat.Breakfast room gets abit crowded in the morning , but again the staff are really quick and helpful in clearing tables.As a family we had a great time and would welcome the opportunity to saty there again

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed for two weeks. As I was on business trip, I wanted to be close to Times Square & subway station (less than 1 km) . This was ideal in that way. The cleanliness of the premises is also maintained. They had a complimentary unlimited hot drink (in those sub zero temperatures) every afternoon and that is a really nice gesture. The breakfast though a limited spread is done nice and kept hot. The WiFi was good except for two days, when I asked for a wired connection (and they were prompt at helping me with this). The staff were courteous and helpful, including the house keeping. Being close to business district, grocery stores and restaurants are easy to find. I also found it to be safe to walk even late night. I had got a better deal from hotels.com site though when I enquired directly from the front desk, it was expensive. The room was tad bit small, but that's NY and space is expensive. (I have been to Singapore and HKG and lived in smaller rooms even at higher rates and bigger brands). Overall pretty happy about the stay.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Out of the countless hotels we have stayed at over the years,the Holiday Inn Express Manhattan West Side was the cleanest, friendliest,and most enjoyable weve ever had.The location couldnt be more perfect,and the front desk was very helpful and gracious. In particular, Supervisor Luis was extremely kind and generous and practically treated us like family.He was just flat-out awesome!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We booked a Friday and Monday stay at this hotel. When we arrived we realized we were at the wrong location. The manager Farah told us that we should stay with them and she would give us a nice quiet room. So we decided to give it a try. Early Saturday morning we heard stay talking loudly and work radio's were loud and quite disturbing. Then two housekeepers stood outside of our door laughing and talking. I had it at this point and opened my door and yelled. When we went to check out Farah asked us how it was. I told her I wanted to cancel my Monday reservation and told her our experience. I could tell that she was very upset. She said please let me make this right. I don't want you to leave here with a bad experience. We decided to stay. When we checked in there was a note from the general manager and a bottle of wine. The note said if our stay was less than perfect to call her immediately. Everything was great!!!! I would highly recommend this hotel. They took ownership of the mistake and corrected it. Any business that does this will always get my repeat business. Thank you again for making our stay perfect!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I can't begin to express how nice it was to deal with such a great, hospitable staff. They made us feel like we had known them forever the moment we walked into the hotel. This HIE may be a little off the beaten path but at least you got the true feeling of NYC. I loved the small bodega's and restaurants close by in Hell's Kitchen and that we were close to everything in the Times Square area. The rooms are clean, the breakfasts were hardy and the coffee was actually pretty decent. I would stay there again in a New York minute!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Was worried, as always when you haven't paid a great deal for a hotel, especially in NYC, and needn't have been! The hotel was clean, staff super friendly, breakfast was fine for what you need - loved the cinnamon rolls! We also had no problems finding somewhere to sit at breakfast. The location was just right - just far enough away from all the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk everywhere. Our room (413) was not small at all, and the bed soooooo comfy. We both slept really well while here. The ONLY negative about the whole thing was the coffee! Awful! Totally watered down - huge disappointment, especially somewhere like NYC where the coffee is usually divine. This is why it gets a 4 not a 5. Even so, will definitely stay again - luckily there's a starbucks 5 mins away!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This was my first time every travelling to New York City and I could not have picked a better place to stay!! The rooms were so nice, and clean. The staff really made me feel at home... Richard at he front desk was so helpful with all of the attractions and all of the sights to see. Luis also at the front desk was also extremely helpful with directions. Overall the staff was so kind!! The hotel was perfect location, we were able to walk everywhere! Breakfast was delicious and the staff helping with breakfast were so kind and patient as it was always so busy and they had so many guests asking questions. I will definitely stay here again when I come back :)

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Over the past two weeks I had occasion to visit NY twice. I stay at two HIEs and based on these two experiences would choose the HIE Madison Square Garden over this one. Why? This property is more out of the way than the Madison Square Garden Property. Rather than being able to walk to Penn Station from the hotel as you can at Madison Square Garden, this will cost you a taxi ride. It also is marginally walkable to Times Square. Like the other HIEs the lobby was clean, as were the rooms and the staff was courteous and friendly. I purchased an "upgraded" room with a "city view" and what I got was a higher floor, but I wouldn't call looking at cooling ducts a city view. So is given the choice, I would not may the extra money for the view. Breakfast can be tricky as often there will be a tour bus full of passengers making their way into or out of the hotel and the breakfast lounge will be very crowded. Timing your meal offers some respite, but the fare is pretty ordinary. If you are there for more than two days, you will definitely want to find a local cafe to avoid the powdered scrambled eggs and paper thin bacon. That said, it's included in the price of the room.So given the option I would choose the Madison Garden HIE, but otherwise this is a resonable price for what you get in NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: For our spring break, my girlfriend and I wanted to have a great time in New-York. We were first surprised by the price, and when we left, we were completely satisfied with our stay. The breakfast did the job (scrambled eggs, bananas, cereals, etc.), the staff was EXTREMELY friendly and helpful (Ashley, Luis, breakfast guy), especially since it was our first time in the States. Everything was clean. The room was kind of small, but we were there only to nap. Best of all, 9 minute walk to Time Square, I mean like right in the middle. Loved our experience and we will be coming back for sure.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel has a small room but very clean and well maintained. The breakfast is delicious and abundance although it's very crowded most of the time. The staffs are very welcoming and friendly. The hotel is located in midtown in the Hell Kitchen neighbourhood with plenty of restaurants nearby, and within a walking distance to major attractions such as Intrepid museum, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square etc.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel was very nice, clean, and had a great free breakfast. All of the staff were great, esp. Ashley, Luis, and all of the dining staff. They were very helpful, since we hadn't traveled to the city before. The hotel is a good 10 min. walk from Times Square, so it wasn't as convenient as other hotels. However, we had no traffic noise, and we walked off our NY pizza. I was a little worried about the safety of the location, but my daughter and I never felt unsafe while we walked to the hotel at night. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Nice little hotel for the price! Room and public areas were newer and clean. Breakfast was good with plenty of hot and cold choices. Our room had two beds for two people. The room was cozy and could have used a tad more space for luggage and moving around between the beds and desk/tv area. This wasn't so important as we were out of the room most of the time. Beds were comfy, too. Only two or three blocks to theaters, restaurant row, and Times Square, subway, etc. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This motel is located just blocks from all sites in Manhattan. You can walk to anywhere. The rooms are small and the breakfast is crowded after 7:30 a.m. However, if you are in New York to see the sights from Central Park to Broadway to the United Nations, this is the place. The motel is clean & secure.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Very friendly staff,clean,practical and compact rooms. Breakfast is complimentary so is wifi internet. Location is not so good but you can hail a cab easily. Very happy about this property. If you are in town for a few days and dont want to get ripped off by the bigger hotels,this should be your choice.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
