review_body: I still can believe was a how nice this hotel was for the rate and location. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in Midtown and not break the bank. Luis (who was manning the front desk when I arrived) was able to check me in to an UPGRADED room when I arrived 4 hours before check in!
user_name:
sab435
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Chose this hotel because we needed to be somewhere a few blocks away at 9am. Was going to stay in New Jersey but AAA RATE OF $99 was cheaper than anywhere else plus we were upgraded due to platinum status to a corner room on top floor. Hotel is like a HIE you would find in suburbs not a city. First off these are some of the nicest people you will find in NYC working here. The hotel is nice and clean on a quiet block. I have to say the rooms are very nice but a little small. The breakfast area was the best run i have ever seen at a HIE and the guy who runs it seems to know many repeat guest by name. 10 years ago you would not want to be near this area at all, but today it is safe and quiet and less hectic than midtown a 10 minute walk away. I will make sure to return to this hotel in the future.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is unbelievably good value. Every staff person was helpful, friendly, efficient. Rooms are the usual size for NY, iron and ironing board, tea and coffee making facilities are included. Free hot drinks available all day long in dining room, free cookies in the afternoon. Rooms were ready when we checked in before noon - clean, comfortable, lots of pillows, good quality toiletries. Breakfast was more than adequate. Eggs and either bacon or sausage, plain and wheat bread, English muffins, cinnamon rolls, apples, bananas, three different kinds of cereal, juices, hot drinks were all available. Dining room was a tad crowded around 8:30 am, but there was always plenty of food. Location is good, about 5 blocks from the subway. Front desk staff were very helpful with directions and maps, advising on places to go and see. I would use this hotel again in a heart beat.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Nice basic hotel. Staff where very nice. Big single beds in small rooms. Clean and tidy. The hotel was busy, and the breakfast room was full on some mornings. Good hotel for a family holiday. Location is down a quiet one way street. You need to remember "between 11th and 10th avenue" for the taxi drivers, because the number means nothing to them! Easy walking distance to Time Square, and the Intrepid aerospace museum is just around the corner.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Maybe because the room rates of Holiday Inn Express are on the budget range. People in general, the staff - they are a bit more genuine and sincere in hospitality.Staff are extremely friendly. If you're not a stuffed-up snob yourself, you're able to converse on how's your day to what's on TV... It's great to have some sort of human-connection with real people after a long day's work or travel. I was smoking outside, the doorman from Eastern Europe exchanged thoughts on New York City... Interesting to hear what others have to say about the city.Because there's no attitude or much pretense from walking to the lobby and be completely decked out with a fake smile. You can relax without an eye-roll or a stare from head-to-toe looking as if you're a Martian (as long as you're fairly the average Mr./Ms. Joe...) I guess depends what you like. Some do like all the glitz and glam with a massive hangout bar/lounge in the hotel...The location is towards the outskirts of the Mid (Upper Mid) West Side. It's slightly away from all the hustle and bustle. Not bad to have a walk to/from the hotel in the morning/afternoon after sight-seeing/work, consider that a chill-out, cooling off walk and you'd get to have a good night sleep.15-minutes or so by foot to Columbus Circle and Central Park. About the same to Times Square.
user_name:
Arnold W M
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We booked the HIE via a same day hotel app and got a great deal. We had to book last minute because we checked out of the Best Western President Hotel in Times Square—which we booked weeks ago—after only being in the room for 15 minutes because it was disgusting. Thankfully we found Holiday Inn Express. We recently stayed at a HIE in Los Angeles so we knew what to expect from the brand and were hoping for the same positive experience we had with the LA property.This hotel lived up to what we expected. Price was right. Room was clean. Staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Luis and Juan were super nice and attentive and we're sorry we can't remember more of the staff's names to acknowledge them but everyone was great. The two guys who were setting up breakfast (one was from Miami) were very helpful and friendly.Rooms are not huge but they are not super small either. PROSGreat priceCleanFriendly and helpful staffFree breakfastFree Wifi in roomDirecTVRefrigeratorConsNone we can think ofWe can't say enough how happy we were to be able to get out of our stay at the Best Western and check into this Holiday Inn Express. We will definitely stay here again as it is well worth the money in the Times Square-ish area.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I'm chaperoning a 10th grade Humanities, Arts and Media trip with my high school. Luis has provided great service and has gone above and beyond to ensure our stay was wonderful.Thanks so much, Holiday Inn Express and your terrific employees.
user_name:
Lorijazz22
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My Mum, Sister and I came to New York last October half term for the first time, we had such an amazing time, obviously we didn't spend a huge amount of time in the hotel due to exploring the City, but when we were there, we were looked after so well by the friendly staff - Particularly Wioleta and Luria who looked after us perfectly every morning at Breakfast time (Sorry if i have spelt your names wrong!) Overall we would recommend staying here for a trip to New York, it is perfectly located and has everything you would need. We are already planning a trip back this October :-) so we will be booking with you again for sure

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Hotel prices for any Manhattan Hotel are expected to be high for New Years Eve, or any other major Holliday for that matter. The Holiday Inn was no exception. However, for the price this hotel was just a few blocks from Time Square, very clean, incredibly attentive, and friendly staff. I will consider this hotel again for future visits.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My husband and I stayed here over Christmas this year, and there were about a million guests all cramming into the breakfast area each morning. I was a bit embarrassed by the shoving and cutting of my fellow guests, but I was incredibly impressed with the phenomenal service that the breakfast and janitorial staff showed - they were polite, constantly cleaning up messes, and working their tails off! I have never seen such an impressive, TOTAL TEAM work crew. I made sure to write down names from the badges one morning - hats off to Richard, Farrel, Yan, Fernando, and Steven for their ability to stay calm and collected and put the customer's needs first!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel is staffed by the friendliest, most enthusiastic people I've yet to encounter. It makes for a welcoming environment where you feel you're not in anyone's way and people aren't just "doing their job." We had three adults staying in a double, and it was quite cramped. But the furnishings were very nice and the beds were comfortable. Water pressure on the 11th floor isn't the best, but it was fine enough. The breakfast was good, but I was not happy to see the use of so much styrofoam.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is in a great location close to Times Square. The staff was amazing. They were so friendly and helpful, just all in all very pleasant. From the front desk to the breakfast staff we were very happy with their hospitality. The room was quite small but definitely served its purpose. The bed was very comfortable and both the room and bathroom very clean. The breakfast was great. Lots of channels on the tv to unwind. We would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Celia B
Sault Ste. Marie, Canada

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for NYE in times square, Staff was friendly breakfast was decent. Not many options for a vegetarian besides bread and fruit. Rooms are small, not much else to say, it’s an average hotel.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Amazing staff and beautiful hotel. Very comfortable and very well located (5 minutes walking from Times Square). Good, free and hot breakfast every morning. This is the place where I'll always stay whenever I go back to New York city.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I took a group of 16 people here for 2 nights. The staff was great! They greeted us and seemed to really care how they might serve us each time we entered. After walking all over in the January cold, we were greeted with free, hot apple cider. The beds were so comfortable I asked for the make of the bed to buy one for my home. I will try to go there next time as well. I suggest getting a room away from the street.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel was a good value for Manhattan. Located in the Hell's Kitchen area, the hotel is a bit off the beaten path from public transportation, but completely doable if you don't mind carrying your luggage from the subway. Good service and clean rooms, definitely a good choice for a low key business stay on a budget.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We're used to having a really small room in NYC and other big cities, but if you're not, be prepared. They are tiny, with very little room for your stuff. I was very impressed with the staff's helpfulness. Breakfast was a zoo but staff did their best to keep the food stocked and the tables cleared. The elevators were extremely slow. The fitness center is small but has new equipment. It's a brisk walk to Times Square and 9th Avenue. There was construction going on across the street, so a lot of noise. Our fridge didn't work, but we put leftovers on the ledge to keep them cold.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: From the moment we arrived every staff member went out of their way to be friendly. This was not a fake plastic smile, but each exuded a genuine concern that we were enjoying our stay. When we checked in the clerk was very helpful and was able to give us a room on the backside of the hotel away from street noise and the construction site across the street.This is a very new hotel that is a short hike from Times Square. The walk is through a mostly residential area and felt very safe as we returned after an evening Broadway show. As you are walking turn downtown on 9th Avenue and you will find a huge number of interesting restaurants that run the gambit from quick grab and go to nice sit-down ethnic eateries. For New York the rooms were quite spacious. The room was extremely clean and very pleasantly decorated. The breakfast was quite able and similar to other Holiday Inns. The difference was how the workers interacted with the guests. Each was eager to be sure we were enjoying our meal. There was ample food and lots of fresh fruit.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My BF and I stayed here for one night. The staff (Farrah!) was super friendly and helpful! Everyone I ran into started polite conversation and was so nice. The bed and pillows are comfy and I slept like a dream. The TV offers many cable channels and the bathrooms were clean & stocked. They offer breakfast, coffee and on Saturday had a delicious hot apple cider. We were even upgraded to a better room with a view of the water! The only negative I could say is that the elevators are incredibly slow, but they are old & that is to be expected. You are also only a few blocks down from Time Square - a perfect location! You are also right around the corner from Restaurant Row! I would definitely stay here again when I visit New York! Keep up the great work!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff from the booking experience on the phone through checkout were exceptional. Driving here from Boston was very easy - it's right off the major throughway into the city. Also bonus - there is a parking lot that you can park in at a discounted rate. Breakfast included was a great perk - especially in the city. Beds were very comfy. Staff was awesome and very detail oriented - they saw me carrying flowers in for my girlfriend's birthday and wished her happy birthday as we left for the day - nice touch. Thanks for a great stay! you rock!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Booked on Hotwire 12/27 for same night in NYC. Got a late start because of a scheduling conflict and after seeing a show arrived at midnight. I did call at 5 pm to say we were still coming. Arrived after group of 20 and waited for 30 minutes. Given room on "Ground floor" which really meant basement as we had to go underground. Literally our room was where they stored all the laundry and maintenance rooms were. I walked into hallway in my underwear at 130 am to ask the maintenance if this is what it was going to be all night, opening and closing doors. He apologized and said no. When we awoke we had no TV but they fixed within 3-4 minutes. Usual free breakfast food. Was faster to go outside using fire exit to go up one flight instead of waiting for elevator. 2 1/2 blocks from 8th ave and another 2-3 south to Times Square

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Everyone was so courteous and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. We'd never stayed in that part of town before but were pleasantly surprised. It was very quiet and had lots of places to eat within a short distance. We would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
cpn46
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: great customer service, walking distance to all popular NY destinations. Very pleasant and clean rooms, great hotel staff. We enjoyed our short stay, and would reccommend especially if you are going on a cruise you have a 5 minute walk to the docks.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Don't know how they hired so many nice people, but they did! Everyone went out of their way to ask if we were enjoying our stay, needed anything, etc! Breakfast was very good, lots of options, and at closing time instead of herding us out, they were bringing out more food! Beds and pillows were comfy. Everything was clean. The room was not large but it is NYC, and it was perfectly fine! Hubby was working a show at the Javits and he was able to walk there and I could walk over to Times Square, etc. Great!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location for walking to all the Mid-town attractions (Times Sq., theaters, 5th Ave. shopping, Rockefeller Center and more). We had two rooms ( a double and a king) and both were well appointed, beds were comfortable, and extremely clean and quiet. A true value!This is an extremely well run hotel with great service...from the bottles of water and snacks upon check in to the friendly, helpful staff. The breakfast room is well run with a very diverse selection. There were 5 of us, including two boys, and everyone found something that pleased them each morning and filled them up. The breakfast room staff was attentive, friendly and kept the tables cleaned and the food fresh and hot. Great job to a group of hard working, helpful professionals.Also want travelers to know that we walked back and forth to the hotel both day and night and always felt safe.Great place to stay and a great value!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We chose the Holiday Inn Express because of the location, the value and the reviews read on how clean the property was. The location was great, the price was right and we couldn't have asked for a cleaner hotel. There was always someone cleaning something- from the lobby floors to the elevator doors. Our room was very small but the bathroom was a decent size- plus the toiletries provided by the hotel were Bath & Body Works brand! The breakfast provided was more than adequate and offered bagels, pancakes, eggs and a different type of breakfast meat each day. They also had a variety of cereal, fruit, yogurt, juices and individual cartons of milk. The hotel provided two computers with a fast printer that was accessible 24/7. The staff was super friendly and always wanted to help. We had them call us a cab to head to the airport on our last day- unsure what exactly happened but when we went to leave, there was a limousine waiting for us out front which was offered to us at the same price as a taxi. The blocks are long toward Times Square area but definitely walkable. When we got tired, we opted for the bus which we caught only 3 blocks away- it was a straight shot to the middle of all the action! Get a metro pass if you are staying for a couple days or more- it saved us and is valid on the bus and the subways.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This Hotel is brand new and very clean. The staff were all incredibly friendly and service oriented.The breakfast was excellent...much more than I expected...a full breakfast with eggs, sausages or bacon, fruit, bagels, juice, coffee.My only comment would be that the rooms seemed small. We had 3 people staying in a 2 bed room and there was little room to put suitcases. A suggestion might be to install some bars on a wall to accommodate more than one suitcase. My only other suggestion concerns a package I had sent to the Hotel (from Harry and David's) with instructions for it to be delivered to the room.The package had arrived but was held and I had to ask for it specifically. A suggestion might be when a package arrives to make a comment on the customer's reservation. I would have been very impressed upon check-in if they would have advised that my package from Harry and David's had arrived and handed it to me then.Minor comments...overall the experience was first rate...the location was excellent within walking distance to Broadway and Time Square. When I go back to New York I will definitely book at this Hotel again. Thank you for a very comfortable stay.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by the overall quality of the hotel. The customer service was excellent. Everyone was so pleasant and helpful no matter what time you were entering the hotel. The price included a full breakfast which was pretty good. Coffee and tea was complimentary all day. My only negative comment was the rooms are very small. But given that we came in late and left early, I was ok with that. The rooms were very clean.Location is a tad off the the beaten path. Parking cars was up a block. But I would highly recommend this Holiday Inn. I plan on going back to this hotel for my future NYC visits

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: After finding a great deal on this hotel its almost too good to be true! I last stayed in new york at the Wellington hotel, which itself was lovely but not a patch on the friendly, relaxed atmosphere if the holiday inn.great location, fab, ,friendly staff and an amazing breakfast. They also have hot drink facilities in reception throughout the day as well as offering hot apple cider for free every other day. Would highly recommend this hotel to anybody. Nice modern rooms and not too far out from times square.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Staff were very helpful, Juan at reception was a fabulous help. Arriving from Australia we had no idea of what was on, Juan seen us right with extensive knowledge of what was on offer around town. At breakfast the staff of Wioleta, Luris and Farrell were always smiling, happy and helpful, their service was exceptional. We would stay again. Great location with easy walking from this central location.Thank you Farrah, you have great staff, keep looking after them.Hugs and Love to all Allen and Janeen, Lightning Ridge NSW Australia

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for three nights as I had a business expo not far away from there (at Javits Center). Picked up this hotel due to proximity to the center as well as other businesses I had to visit.The best thing about this hotel are the people working there. All of them were wonderful, very helpful, knowledgeable and extremely friendly. 5 star service, no question about that.My room was small, typical HIE room, there was all I needed. Furniture is a little bit outdated but that didn't bother me at all. Bathroom could be improved (had no shelf next to sink to leave my toothpaste and toothbrush on, for example). Room as well as rest of the hotel was very clean.Lift - sometimes I had to wait quite long for it. There are only two lifts and I could see that staff were using them too (probably there is no staff lift in this one).Breakfast - the only good thing about it is that it's free. Cheap quality and poor taste (OK coffee though, and fresh bananas were good). If this was charged extra, that would be wrong. Internet is fast and free as well, worked well for me.All in all, a very good hotel, I would recommend to business and leisure travelers to NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel room itself is very small with loud construction outside but the customer service far exceeds those details. Farrah (manager), Louis M. and Richard were extremely accommodating by moving our room to a higher floor with less noise. They even called to make sure we were pleased with the new room. The rooms were very clean with comfortable beds and high thread count comfy sheets. The breakfast in the morning had a large variety with wonderful staff always willing to help, loved their beautiful smiles.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This place is nice affordable and convenient. The staff members are friendly and helpful. It's not far at all from restaurants, park, and times sq is only a couple of blocks away. Great place to stay if you don't like noise (such as car and/ppl traffic). My only complaint would be the construction being done to the street.....but its has nothing to do with the hotel. There are 3 club/lounges not far(if you're into that), and bars not to far either. I would stay there again. Best part is that it's a smoke free hotel. So you know your rm won't have that disgusting cigarette smell. Btw their bkft isn't bad either. You don't get those imitation egg mcmuffin looking stuff. They actually have bkft that appears to be done in the hotel ( scramble eggs, biscuits, bacon, coffee, hot cider, etc).

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised during my stay. After hearing the horror stories of neighboring hotels, I was hesitant. Instead, the front desk staff was very friendly and allowed us to check in early. The room was clean, fairly small but average to NYC standards. I'm a germaphobe so I check sheets twice over, clean. The breakfast staff was very friendly. Breakfast consisted of eggs, biscuits, pancakes, bacon, toast, cereal, oatmeal, pastries, sausage, juices, coffee, etc. the concierge was helpful in assisting us to find activities and tour hotspots. Wifi was free (once we downloaded the kindle app) or you can opt to use the free computers & printer near the lobby. Comfy beds. When we requested a dnd sign, they delivered quickly. The neighborhood was fairly quiet, away from the hustle & bustle even though walking distance to times square. Only complaint is that we got a better deal on Expedia compared to the HIE website, I'm not a fan of their price match policy. The tiles in the showers could also use servicing. I enjoyed my stay. This location is fairly new, I hope they continue to provide great guest experience over time.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I have stayed in many hotels and of all the hotels I have stayed in this is the one that puts the most effort into customer satisfaction. Particularly good service for breakfast. Only drawbacks rather small room and construction noise from opposite side of W 48th St.
user_name:
Robert T
Ville de Saguenay, QC, Canada

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The rooms are average size for New York City rooms - but this hotel has the friendliest staff in NYC. It has a great breakfast bar - with 2 staff members on-site during the breakfast with a smile! Water is hot. Beds and pillows are comfortable. And for it only being 2.5 avenue blocks away from Times Square - it was very affordable. It took us 10 minutes to get from our Broadway play to the hotel. Highly recommend and will stay there next time I'm in NYC.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Absolutely everyone at this hotel went out of their way to greet us and make our stay terrific. Luize, Farrell, and Melvin at the breakfast room were just fantastic. An engineer named Latch was in the elevator with us and rather than ignoring us, he struck up a conversation and wished us a great visit. Even the housekeeping folks greeted us in the hallway and were warm and welcoming. You just don't see that kind of focus on making the customer welcome at every hotel, and these guys were terrific. The room was clean, comfortable, well appointed, and roomy for NYC. The hotel is a few blocks from Times Square and in a nice quiet neighborhood. We will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: holiday inn express is always a safe bet. clean rooms, very polite staff and a solid breakfast to set you up for a day of sight-seeing. this one is a 10 minute walk from Broadway and Times Square and a 5 minute walk from a metro station so location is excellent. there are also literally 100"s of great eating and drinking spots within a 5 minute walk. the only downside is that there is building work going on directly over the road. (old building demolished and currently bulldozers digging foundations - pneumatic drills at 7am are not fun). So provided you make sure you get a room on the quiet side of the building, this is a good option if you are a tourist on a budget. i would have given it 4 stars if it wasn't for the noise.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Very impressed with this hotel. Staff were great and room was very comfortable. Good features including a bath (rather than shower), good wifi, in room fridge, room safe and a large LED tv. Breakfast was good vareity and never issues relating to availability of tables or running out of food. Very short walk (less than 10 mins to Times Square or 50th Street subway station).Hotel was very clean and staff could not do enough to make me feel welcome or offer advice.Will definetly be back.Thanks

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Perfect hotel for family. Rooms were clean and spacious enough for family of 4. New furnishings throughout hotel. Every employee we came into contact with was gracious and accomodating from the asst. manager to the employee who brought us a new hairdryer. Quick response to all our requests with a great attitude. Breakfast bar was well stocked with lots of options for a healthy breakfast. Perfect place to stay--only a few blocks from restaurant row and Times Square. My daughter lives in NYC and I have stayed in lots of hotels while visiting her--this is by far the best value for the money.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I thought this hotel was perfect! Far enough away from the tourist bubble that it was quite but a quick walk and you are right back in the mix. Breakfast makes for an economical option to start the day.
user_name:
Justin W
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We were very impressed with the cleanliness on the common areas and room within the hotel. Friendly and helpful hotel staff made us feel at home during our 4 night stay. A four block hike to Times Square and a one block hike to 9th Ave (restaurant row) make this location very convenient. Subways were several block away. Hot and cold complimentary breakfast served daily.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is in a great location and easy to walk anywhere. We booked our reservations at this hotel using Priority Club points. Using the website to reserve the room was misleading..the IHG website offered options with rooms & money only to find it was not available. Recommend IHG/Priority Club offer what is available for the dates, not all options. We used a lot of points for this hotel but it was worth it.Once we arrived we found the hotel is only 6 months old and very clean. The staff is excellent and go out of their way to accommodate. Woileta & Luria are the breakfast attendants and they ensured the area was clean, talked to the guest, and ensured food was available. The rooms are small and the bathroom is smaller (we had three people sharing rooms). This was ok because we spent little time at the hotel. I definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We went up for a 3 night stay in NYC and had a great experience at The Holiday Inn Express. It was excellent, very clean and centrally located. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to accomodate us when we needed an extra room and helped us by making restaurant recommendations. The breakfasts each morning were delicious and there was alot of variety. The staff came through during breakfast to make sure all was well and that we were enjoying the food. There is a nice sitting area outside the hotel and when you enter the lobby there is a large cooler of water with fruit slices in it. It is very refreshing. This was my second stay at a Holiday Inn Express (the other was in Ocean City, MD) and both have been outstanding. In particular the staff at both hotels have been extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful.
user_name:
M Bonnie D
Silver Spring, Maryland

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This place is clean, comfortable, and very very friendly. Good concierge service. Breakfast included, including eggs and sausage in addition to the typical carbs. Free wifi work very well. Construction on this block, but safe. This hotel is in Hell's Kitchen, but short safe walk to Time Square and subway.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: First, the staff members of the hotel were all very friendly and accommodating and the room appointed to me was well-maintained and clean. The hotel is located on 48th and 11 so that it's 2 streets and 3 avenues away from Subway A, C and E (blue line) - about 10 blocks or 10-minute walk. It's right across a construction site and a Salvation Army shelter for the homeless. If you need to park a car, there are ICON Parking lots about 2 blocks away.You'll need to walk to 9th avenue to get to the foodie scene of Hell's Kitchen. Everything was good except that the hotel management forgot to notify hotel guests of the ongoing construction across the hotel. I had a dinner and party on the night I checked in, and got home fairly late - around 3 AM. I went to bed around 330 AM. I woke up abruptly around 7AM to the tune of jackhammering and pile hammering. Unfortunately, my room is facing the construction site next to the Salvation Army shelter for the homeless. My room was on the 8th floor, but the noise from the jackhammers is still very loud.I called the front desk around 730 AM and told them about the issue and they can only offer me ear plugs. I requested for a late checkout, and they gladly gave me one as I thought the jackhammering wil subside after a couple of hours. I tried going back to sleep but the pile hammering was relentless and incessantly annoying that I went in and out of sleep for a couple of hours until finally I couldn't bear the noise and had called up again and spoken to the hotel director to let her know of the situation. She said that it's too late for me to be transferred to another room since I am checking out a few hours later. She said that the construction workers are contracted to do work from 7AM-5PM. The jackhammering was non-stop from 7AM to 1PM when I checked out. I just hoped that the hotel management let the hotel guests beforehand that there will be construction noise throughout the day so that guests are prepared. All in all I got about 3 hours of sleep that day, and a goodnight's sleep is and should be the most important priority of hotels to their guests.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I came into this hotel on Priceline, and was somewhat nervous because of the reviews, however, my concerns were quickly alleviated on arrival. I am a seasoned NYC traveller, and this hotel definitely does not deserve the current rating based on my experience.I had asked for a standard room, however, they moved me to a 2 bed room on the top floor, which was fine. The room itself was small, and the desk space was limited due to the lamp, but otherwise it was a good clean space. There was a fridge in the room, which was a great bonus.The hotel has a great seating area outside, a good place to wait for a ride or to relax.It is between 10th and 11th Ave, so a good 5 mins to the crowds, but I liked this. The restaurants on 9th ave are closer to this hotel than if you are staying right in Times Square, as its only 1.5 blocks. There is no shortage of them!The staff were always incredibly pleasant and helpful. Nothing was too difficult for them.It is a 5-10minute walk to the subway, so probably would be frustrating if wet, however this was not a problem for me. Walking back to the hotel at midnight also did not cause me any concern at all.I imagine it will be better when all the roadworks are done, and the building around the location completed, but overall, i enjoyed my time at this hotel, and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: To start describing this experience I had problems to book. I had the bad idea to redeem points and then find out I could not book a paid night. After writing and talking to all possible IHG staff I was informed that this was a hotel police and nothing could be done. I went ahead and stayed in the hotel. I was first very surprised that people in the hotel knew about my case, because it was written in my folio, but all people I talked to denied that the hotel had anything to do with not being able to book my second night, so clearly or this is a big misunderstanding and lack of communication between IHG and the hotel, or someone is lying to me. Anyway, the hotel is average, not good or bad as first impression, room is small, but comfortable, but not very clean, there were towels behind the door from the guests who stayed before, so I was wondering what else was not cleaned. Could not sleep as a group has arrived at 3 am and walls are paper thin, they were yelling for one hour... Next day I had to transfer to another hotel, I had two suitcases and two small children and the only help from the hotel was to walk a block to 11th Av. to hail a taxi, of course by my self, as nobody would help. So I would not recommend if you need more than a bed in a noise place, not be sure about cleanness and no help from staff.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel is located a 15 minutes walk from Times square. If you want your NYC experience to include staying in the heart of the city's tourist attractions, don't book this hotel. Otherwise, its location is a decent distance from all the chaos of midtown Manhattan. The staff was very helpfull and did everything possible to make our stay at the hotel as pleasent as it could be. The breakfast was a refreshing change compared to what we are used to in NYC hotels(which is usually: No breakfast for you). The hotel has over 160 rooms and 11 floors. The two elevators and the not large enough dining area are not enough to handle all the hotel guests. Expect delays when going down to eat your breakfast.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Positives:-within 15 minutes walking distance of the javitts center and the cruise port. -within a 30 minute walking distance of Rockefeller center.-free hot breakfast (typically choices, but free none the less)-reasonable parking garage ab a 5 min walk awayNegatives:-avoid the first floor rooms, we heard employees ALL night long, hard to sleep.-leaking roof in the bathroom, maintenance said they would take care of in the AM and there were no additional rooms available.-located on a run down street due to construction as well as homeless people.All and all we would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Initially I thought the location of this place was too far from the stations. But, then I realized the bus stops was nearby and it was still walkable to the nearest subway station. It is located just far enough from the hustle and bustle of Times Square that it was pleasantly quiet in the evenings and days. Even before entering the establishment, the outside patio area was lit nicely and well kept. The room we stayed in was just as tidy and clean. Staff was even able to even provide a comb that my boyfriend forgot. The breakfast was amazing as well; the hot breakfast changed each day I was there and was pleasantly surprised of the variety of beverages available. I had a pleasant experience and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Great staff, very helpful with directions and places to eat. I do agree with a comment from another site that walls are a little thin. We were right beside elevator and heard it all night and people in hallway. We stayed for New York comicon and will stay here again if we come back.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Booked this hotel based on fabulous ratings containing no bed bugs. This place is excellent in every way. You really get a five star treatment. Super clean rooms, fast responsive staff, not to mention a very good free breakfast daily. I was really impressed. We inspected the beds from a - z with a flashlight. No signs of bed bugs which are really apparent in New York City apparently.Management and all employees including Violeta and Luriz were amazing.I highly recommend this place and will not search no more for a hotel next time we have to visit New York City.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: What more can you ask for? A price of less than $304 per night would be welcome, after all it is ONLY a Holiday Inn Express, but given that the best room we could find on a popular weekend was at this hotel, through priceline for $250 per night plus tax (=$304), at least it was very good. An easy and pleasant walk to the N or M1 bus that crosses the city, a fun neighborhood on the upswing (***love the Hells Kitchen Flea Market on Saturday and the awesome restaurants on 9th...and some nice shops, too including Housing Works- where the money goes to victims of AIDS, HIV and homelessness) . We would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Very clean rooms. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was very good and the breakfast crew was very friendly. The breakfast crew made me feel welcome, always had a smile and made the extra effort to say hello and good morning. They really added to the enjoyment of my stay. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel is in a good location and within walking distance of many main attractions. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and check in / out was efficient. Room came with a breakfast and the scrambled eggs were the best I have eaten from any hotel buffet. Beds were very comfortable but the bathroom fan was very very noisy, sounded as if the bearings were badly worn. But I must emphasise, this did not detract from the pleasantness of our stay

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: like all the Holiday Inn Expresses I've stayed in, loved it. quietly great service, awesome breakfast. would stay here again without a doubt. Times Square/Midtown central without the craziness. only gripe is subways are a five to ten min walk away, however strolled passed a few lovely local landmarks (eg. Clinton Community Garden) on the way to.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Our five night stay here was very comfortable with modern rooms (if a little small) but with all the amenities required. Breakfast provided was excellent and we had no problem with over-crowding. Location a little off the hustle and bustle track, but everything within walking distance so not a problem for us. Staff we encountered were extremely helpful and friendly (all had lovely smiles!) and although we were dubious about staying in a Holiday Inn Express (based on previous experiences in London), we can honestly say that this was an exception and we would have no hesitation in returning here should we be fortunate enough to visit NY again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel is about a five minute walk to the NY cruise terminal..... It is also within walking distance to many of the NY attractions. Very clean! They offer a good breakfast. The staff are absolutely .....friendly, helpful, courteous..... The best!I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying there again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at this Holiday Inn Express; the staff was super friendly and very helpful. We checked in with no problem and our room, although not large, was comfortable and had a nice view of the city. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. There was free WiFi in the room and computers were available in the lobby. The free breakfast was excellent: biscuits, pancakes, omelette, hard boiled eggs, toast, bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit, sausage, and cold cereals. Hot coffee and tea are available 24/7. The only negative thing to say that it is located way on the westside, between 10th and 11th avenues near the Hudson River; the Broadway theaters are about 20 minutes walking distance. There are lots of restaurants and bars on all the avenues nearby.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Ended up staying here at the last minute after a bad experience elsewhere and were really happy to have found this hotel! The room was really clean and modern, and the front desk staff were super friendly and able to check us in 4 hours before regular check in. They seemed to remember personal details about each guest and really took the effort to make us feel welcome. Didn't have a chance to try the breakfast but heard it was good, and free wifi was a plus. The bed was super comfotable with a choice of pillow firmness and a/c was comfortable and easily adjustable. The only con might be that it is about a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest subway station, but we walk a lot so this wasn't a concern and location was otherwise super convenient to most things. We booked our room the day of arrival and got a fantastic rate - would definitely recommned this hotel and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel has the nicest staff I have ever encountered at a hotel! From the moment we walked through the doors, the service was top notch and they made us feel "at home". The rooms are super clean and nicely up-to-date. There is a lovely sitting area out front. The location is one block from the pier. We will definitely stay here again. This Holiday Inn Express is doing everything right!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Everything was great, from room service and temperature control and great showers to free buffet breakfast and organized concierge services.Kelley Cordoba was superb in delivering helpful services!I would recommend the hotel to all. Staff are also bilingual - english and spanish

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: the staff especially Farrel, and others were awesome, friendly, helpful , the rooms were clean and i liked everything,internet was had good speed as well as being reliable, the location of the hotel is awesome as i could access other places in Manhattan easily, we are definitely coming back next year with more friends !! me and my friend Joe Weston enjoyed a lot there staying for 8 days, hi to Farrel

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My wife and I just spent 5 nights here and we must say the staff is the friendliest we have ever encountered and we travel a lot. Nothing was too hard a task for these folks, from check in, to room cleaning, breakfast and just to say hello how are things. No charge internet use and free WIFI in rooms. Rooms a bit small but worked for us, clean, neat, ample breakfast included, coffee station open all the time. A short walk to Times Square and all the Hop on Hop off buses( a great way to see the city) or the subway, another easy way to get around. Lots of good restaurants in the area, remember you are in Hells Kitchen.Thanks Holiday Inn Express Manhattan West for helping make our "Holiday" truly enjoyable.P&J James

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Luis got us the room we asked for even though Priceline didn't guarantee it, and they were over booked. The room is clean and the staff couldnt be friendlier. No complaints at all. Good place. Go Luis.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and just loved it. 5star staff - you can visibly see that they believe in customer is number 1. Kids and business friendly. Internet, printer use with no extra cost. The location is awesome - Hell's kitchen is more residential than commercial. 100s of nice reastaurants; most will deliver to the hotel till late. We walked to Broadway, time square, 5th ave everyday. We had a great vacation and the hotel definitely was a big reason.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff is friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help. The rooms are nicely appointed and all new....very comfortable beds and pillows.The breakfast was ample and good, with coffee all day.Between 10th and 11th Aves. but really a short walk to anything.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This hotel was awesome. Of course the rooms are small - it's Manhattan all rooms are small. The staff were so friendly and accommodating, I think that is what sells the hotel. They have the typical Express good breakfast which saved us a fortune. Kids loved the cinnamon buns. I have celiacs disease and can't have any wheat products but I had plenty of choice with the breakfast. The parking is a little more than a block away so while it is a bit of a haul - it's not that bad. The room was clean and cool (it was really hot in NYC when we went!) and thoughtfully furnished. The location of the hotel is good, the subway was about a 10+ minute walk away. There is a really nice patio on the front of the hotel which was great for morning coffee and listening to the City get going.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: If you want a place central to Manhattan NYC, this is the place to stay! It's up a quiet street, off 7th Ave,not far from Macy's,Broadway & Time Square, but far enough from the madness of NYC. There are lots of great restaurants in the areaThe first night we were there, we were in a room off the lobby, but found it very noisy (the ice machine down the hallway) But the next day we asked to be moved & it was absolutely no problem to do so!The rooms are a decent size & were lovely & clean. There were tea making facilities, plus you can always get tea & coffee 24hrs downstairs in the breakfast area.Just go to breakfast early as it gets rather busy, in a small area. The breakfast is great & they never ran short of anything as there was always someone there refreshing the food. Great thing is that it is free! All the staff were so friendlyThank you Holiday Inn for a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Just got back from NYC, was in quick vacation with the kidsEvery thing about the hotel is nice, the rooms are really smallAnd the gym was a disappointment for my son according to him there was nothing for his workout program We actually had to leave early because of that

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Staff were very nice and helpful. Needed to heat up some breakfast in microwave as could not eat what was available there. As there was no m/w, a staff member volunteered to heat it up for me in the employee m/w. That was very nice! Most reviews are correct-definitely not enough elevators for the traffic at the hotel. Make sure your room is on one of the lower floors so you can walk up and down the stairs. Breakfast area is very crowded and had to eat outside every morning. Not sure how that will work when it is raining, cold, etc.. The location is fine. No issue with Salvation Army. It is a fine area to walk through-day or night. Subway is a bit farther than some other midtown areas, but it's fine. The room had everything we needed and the size was fine for 2 people. I would recommend a room in the rear so you don't hear construction and traffic. Ours was very quiet. For being open only a few weeks, the staff did a great job. I would definitely stay here if the price is right.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This is a shout out to Luis, Juan, Richard, Kelly and all the amazing staff at HIE - West Side!The staff at this location is outstanding and made us feel like we were staying at the Ritz Carlton:)The breakfast was great - a real saving when in Manhattan. The location was perfect and the beds were super comfy plus the rooms have a frig and a coffee maker. Yeah! My husband and I are now calling this 'our' hotel when we are in NYC!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I recently stayed here and found it to be very convenient to most of the places we needed to get to. Short Walk to Time Square, Transit, Broadway, etc... Hotel Staff were very helpful and friendly no matter what time of day. Rooms were clean and reasonably well appointed (could have used as Bottle Opener). As with many hotels that have free breakfasts the area was very crowded and and was challenging to get to the food most days. Thankfully there was a great outside lounging area that could be used to take food to. Coming from an area where smoking in common space has limitations the proximity to cigarette smoke on the common patio was overwhelming occasionally. (perhaps the hotel could handle that differently) I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone that wants to have a great central point to do the normal touristy activities.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Friendly and very helpful staff compensated for things like no towels upon arrival. Noise starts at 7:30a.m. Lots of construction. The patio area in front of the hotel, the coffee all day, the breakfast are all a nice touch.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Ok let's deal with negatives first !! It's expensive to stay anywhere in Manhattan and despite being a holiday inn express we paid $182 per night compared to about £59 in the UK for the same brand of hotel. Also no matter where you stay in Manhattan it's noisy so accept it !! Unfortunately a cross the road from the hotel at the moment is building work going on and they work Monday to Friday.Now the positives !!!We stayed here for 4 nights after travelling across from the UK on the QM 2 and arrived at the hotel at 9am expecting just to be able to drop our luggage off. We were greeted with a very polite welcome from the reception staff and told that a room was already available. They gave us a welcome bag with 2 bottles of water and a couple of local guides. The room was ample with 2 queen size beds and a decent bathroom. We found location wise it was in a safe area and only 10 mins walk from Times Square. Every time we left or arrived at the hotel, staff were very polite and acknowledging. Breakfast was a big plus as many new york hotels don't offer it and whilst busy the choice was good and always being replenished.The bed was comfy and whilst we heard noise outside it didn't ruin our sleep at all.Upon leaving the staff were very friendly again and thanked us for our stay.I can't fault the hotel, location or staff and would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to pay less than $200 per night in New York.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed here for one night with an excellent discount, so I cannot comment on the price of our stay-- it couldn't be beat. The front desk staff was very pleasant upon check-in. Our king-bed room was spotless, however small. No complaints for the small room, as we're used to that in big cities. When I made the reservation, I did request a room on an upper floor, but we were only put on the 2nd floor. Since we were only there for one night, I didn't complain. I did notice that when people were talking in the hallway, it was rather loud in our room. When the AC fan was turned on high, it nicely drowned out any hallway noise. The next morning however, the construction site across the street was in full swing around 7am, and this noise could not be disguised by the AC. I don't even know if a higher floor room would have made much difference. Fortunately the construction should only last for a limited time.The complimentary breakfast was very nice, and the additional outdoor seating was quite necessary when breakfast was busy.One suggestion to the hotel would be to make the outdoor cigarette receptacles more obvious for guests. I noticed the smoking guests dropping their ashes and butts onto the patio, (hopefully) because they didn't notice the small receptacles in the corner. If I stay here again, I would make sure I was on an upper floor (above 7 or 8), and possibly ask for a non-street facing room, to escape the street noise.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This new HI Express popped up on my radar just in time for a planned trip to New York. I am glad it did. Open only a few months, it is located just a few blocks from the theater district and Hell's Kitchen restaurants, and about 3 blocks from the Intrepid Museum. The nearest subway is probably 4 blocks, although Times Square is only a block or two farther.The hotel was extremely well run; the staff was very friendly, knowledgeable, and on top of everything. One could tell they were very eager to make sure everything was done right. The breakfast was pretty standard for an HI Express (eggs, bacon, breads, juice, etc.) and it was FULLY stocked all the posted time, every day. This is actually pretty unusual in a tourist hotel in NY in the summer, so they get high marks from me on in this regard. The hotel seemed very full, which made finding a seat at breakfast a challenge sometimes, but they have a great seating area in front of the hotel outside, which was very nice on sunny mornings.My room was small by normal standards, although quite large for a hotel of this class in Manhattan. The beds were new and very comfortable, and everything was spotless. My only complaint in that regard is that the housekeeping staff never left the correct number of towels; we had to call every day to get correct replacements.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Manhattan West Side recently with the fiancee. As other posters have mentioned, this is a brand spanking new hotel, and so if you're the kinda guy/gal that gets new car scent air fresheners, this is probably a place you will have on your "Hotels in NYC to stay at" list. The entire stay was average. Nothing spectacular, and nothing horrendous. Further details below:The Good:- It's new. As in, some of the door hinges still have plastic stuck to them (like they were just purchased from Home Depot and installed yesterday night kind of a feel).- The staff are friendly.- They offer free breakfast, for those on a budget. See below, though.- Two computers are available for your use, with a free printer. Though usually they seemed to be occupied by 12 year olds on Youtube. Don't their parents realize that Youtube is a pretty bad babysitter?- WiFi is reasonably speedy, and free.- For Priority Club members with any status, your gift is chocolate and chips.The Bad:- Location. There is a Salvation Army directly across the street. No, not the store where you buy used clothes when you're trying to be hip, or finding a Hallowe'en costume. Like a place where people who are down on their luck are living. Be aware that you are several blocks away from the main thoroughfares, meaning you walk through at least a few questionable residential buildings before arriving at the hotel. During my stay, I never felt unsafe. Did I feel as safe as I would have if I were staying in the middle of Times Square (albeit, at a hotel that costs 5x as much)? No. I just wouldn't want to be walking home, as an attractive female, by myself at 3AM. But then again, where would that ever be safe?- The breakfast was free, meaning their offerings were average, at best. Standard Holiday Inn fare (do they all shop at the same discount food provider?), meaning lots of carbs, and little in the way of fresh products. Waffle makers, cinnamon buns, bacon, eggs etc. are available. If you're trying to be on an anti-typical-American-diet and doing the whole health thing, your best bets will be limited to oranges and oatmeal. Also, the crowds are nuts. It's like they were serving gourmet fare or something. Lineups starting as soon as they opened the breakfast.- The elevator/rooms situation. The elevators are about the size of the rooms. As in, they're both postage sized. Elevators are slow during prime times, to the point where I just started taking the stairs. And try fitting in two big people with their suitcases... it ain't going to happen. The rooms are the size of your bathroom at home.- Sound proofing. Why can't hotels do this properly? I don't get it. They understand you are there to sleep, but can't make sure you are in a quiet room. We could hear night club music all night long, and as much as I love Kaskade, I don't want that blaring when I'm sleeping.The Ugly:- The clientele. There are some groups of people who are obnoxious, and they apparently all love to stay at this hotel. My fiancee was pushed (yes, pushed) off an elevator because she did not immediately step off once the door opened.In summary, you could do better if you were willing to spend a little more. But then if that was the case, why would you be looking at the Holiday Inn chain? It wasn't a bad experience, and I'd stay again if the price was right. If I could, 3.5 stars would be a reasonable rating.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Having read some reviews I am pleased to say that our stay at the Holiday Inn Express West Side was fine. The hotel is about a 10 minutes walk from Times Square and the subway system, we found the area safe, lively and lots of restaurants within 5 minutes walk. I was there with my family on a 4 day stopover in New York. We found the check-in speedy and courteous and the hotel staff warm and friendly. The room was clean, comfortable and did not experience any issues with the lifts. The breakfast was busy but there was enough room for us to sit down and eat a hearty breakfast before setting of for the day. When we returned in the evening the hotel has a pleasant outside seating area where you can sit down and socialise. Luis from reception arranged a Taxi for us to Newark airport which accidentally turned out to be a stretched limo at the same price as a regular taxi (plus toll & tip). Great way to finish off a trip to New York and thanks Luis.A big thank you to all the hotel staff for making our family trip to New York a great holiday to remember. I am sure I will be booking another stay there at some point.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Check in was quick and friendly. It was raining hard when we arrived and were immediately offered towels to dry off before check in. The room is small but very clean. Beds were comfortable and air conditioning worked well. We were by the elevator and did not hear any noise. There is construction across the street that starts early during week days. The elevator is a little slow due to staff usage but tolerable. Breakfast was the usual HIE breakfast - refilled quickly and lots of staff. Seating was short but on nice days there is plenty of outside seating. We had a problem with our television and it was fixed within 5 minutes. We asked for extra towels at 2 am and they were at our door within minutes. Service was great!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: First of all, the staff here is quite nice and friendly. That's a plus. But, this hotel is more like a small, boutique hotel with European-sized rooms. That means most Americans will be disappointed with the size and find navigating in a room this size is difficult. I feel the hotel should say that in their advertisement upfront and should charge an appropriate price for the rooms which is affordable. This is not a good deal for a family of four or more. The double rooms are really only large enough for two adults, and that's a stretch. The Salvation Army shelter across the street does not have a curfew because you can hear men outside all hours of the night and a radio going. Then, there is construction next door to it that starts the minute the sun comes up. We felt the entire stay was noisy and uncomfortable and regretted that we didn't book somewhere else. I feel this property is best for college kids or singles who don't travel with extensive luggage or a family in tow. Other than that, it was clean and convenient. If you like ethnic foods, there are of ethnic restaurants that are easy to walk to. Again, please be advised that this is amore like a boutique hotel with European-sized rooms. I think it is only fair that people be aware of that when booking.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The hotel is located on west 48th between 10 and 11 ave. it is very close to the tunnel exits so traffic is really bad during rush hours. there are constructions going on infront of the hotel and along 48th so the noice level is very untolerable. What is great is their cutomer service. Everyone is nice and very helpful especially the front desk personnels and the 2 ladies in charge of the breakfast are.I cant remember their names but they are all great.The rooms are small and the breakfast area is way too small with the number of guests they have. The housekeeping staff is sketchy and very unfriendly.The elevators are the slowest ones on earth. Better to use the stirs.will I come bcak? Maybe not.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I don't write reviews. Everyone asks for one, so it becomes overwhelming. In this case, however, I ASKED how I could write a review. Let me get one thing out of the way ... it's a Holiday Inn Express. If you want frills, this isn't for you. BUT if you want service, this hotel meets and exceeds that of any hotel I've ever stayed at. The staff is friendly and eager to please and I wish I could remember the names of all the people [like Ashley, Anikat(?), Juan, Farah, Latch] who bent over backwards to make sure our stay was pleasant, our requests were fulfilled and our needs were met. They understood why they were there, and then some. Kudos to the management for finding excellent people; kudos to the excellent people for doing a terrific job. I'd love to return.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: From the moment we walked in the door I was relaxed. This was not the typically NYC hotel experience. Rooms are a bit small but the price is right, the location is great and the staff are awesome. Luis at the reception desk set the tone for 3 comfortable days in the city. I recommend this hotel for low key comfort and convenience. The staff definitely made up for the construction across the street. The property is brand new!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I don't have a lot to add to previous comments as I agree with most: SUPER, super slow elevator, noisy construction, way-too-small breakfast area, friendly front desk staff, sketchy housekeeping, small rooms. I was never concerned with the Salvation Army across the street and the price paid was decent for NYC.I do, however, want to elaborate about housekeeping. I'm sure the GM reads these reviews and this may be the first she learns of it. The first day my room was cleaned as it should have been. On the second day my room was cleaned very late in the day - after 5:30. Very annoying to come back to after being in the city the whole day. When I got back that evening housekeeping had visited and done the following: made the bed, left two bath towels. That's all. No toiletries, no, washcloths, no bath mat. The trash wasn't emptied and the ice bucket remained full from the previous night with melted ice. The next morning I left at 9:30 am. I specifically asked that my room be cleaned sooner rather than later. I saw the desk agent write it down in a notebook. Apparently that's as far as my request went. I got back to the room at 5:30pm. The room had not been touched. I went to the desk and the solution was to move me to another room three floors up. I guess this was a so-so fix since I didn't want to wait for HK to service the room, but I was ticked off. I was promised a phone call from the manager by "9 or 10, but no later than 10" that night. Not a peep. The next morning at checkout I requested some kind of financial remuneration. I was credited $100, which I appreciated. The point is that this never should have happened. The HK supervisors should be replaced - there's no excuse for doing a poor job like that.Would I stay here again? No. Coming back to a dirty room, in my opinion, is a severe compromise of the contract you make with the hotel when you book.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: In all the hotels I have ever stayed in, I have never had to take my breakfast to my bedroom to eat it! The dining area is far too small. we are a family of 4, and getting a table was a nightmare even with the extra patio area. Other families as well were cramped around 2 seater tables. It was slightly quieter midweek but weekends are not a pleasant experience. In answer to the location problems noted previously, we had no problems. We walked back from the Top of the Rock evening lights experience through Hells kitchen at 9pm to the hotel and did not feel at all worried for our safety . The salvation army office causes not problems, there are plenty more 'down on their luck' people on other street corners teaching my children 'new words' that caused more problems. Most of the staff are very friendly (Juan&Latch to note) but is ruined by the odd one or two. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with a choice of hard or soft pillows, and our room had thin blind and a thicker shade to make the room dark. The coffee-making in the room sometimes weren't replenished. The ice making machine on our floor was really noisy even when not in use. Would we stay again? If this hotel was the only one in my price range, yes.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We stayed in the Holiday Inn for one night after returning from a cruise. Excellent location for cruises, only 5 mins walk from the Cruise Ship passenger terminal. The hotel was fairly basic; however, and this is from someone who spends more than half his life in 5 star hotels, the staff attitude and the welcome that we received were exemplary. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff on the front desk; from leaving our bags, both before and after our stay, to organising a taxi to take us to JFK and then later bring our passports to the airport after I had left them in the reception area (thanks Lewis, it all worked out). Breakfast is included, however, it can be a bit of a stampede for the buffet. If the inside restaurant area is full there is a nice patio area in front of the hotel. Free coffee available 24/7. Definitely good value for money.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Check-in was fast and pleasantRoom is Tiny. We are a family of four and had two beds, could barely move around the room without literally stepping on each others' toes. Bathroom sink counter was so small we had to store some of our toiletries in the suitcases. Whole hotel is new. Room didn't have shades so we woke up early from the light. I complained to the reception in the morning and they sent a maintenance guy who explained that the shades were removed since they didn't work. In my opinion, if a room does not have shade, you cannot use it. You wouldn't rent a room with no mattress ("mattress was removed since it was out of order"). Same goes for the shades.Shades were installed later on after we reminded the reception.A/C in the room is noisy.The free wifi works fine.The breakfast is plain but fine. No vegetables, and only two choices of fruits, e.g. bananas and apples (depending on the day). If you get there at rush hour, you probably won't find a place to sit down. Also, some items run out and the hotel has a hard time keeping up with the replenishing.Elevators are pretty slow as well.Location is just okay. On one hand it's three blocks away from Times Square, but to get there you need to cross Hell's Kitchen which isn't exactly New York's finest neighborhood. I'd hate to walk there at night by myself. Right in front of the hotel there's a branch of the Salvation Army. A few down-on-their-luck men are loitering there at all times of day and night. Not that I felt there was a safety concern, but it's a bit depressing that's hardly the sight you're looking for while on vacation.Fitness room is cardio only. We used it twice and we were alone. All new equipment so it's fine.We paid $249 + taxes per night. In hindsight I think we could have done better for this price.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Lovely staff who made sure that i'm happy and calm with my room, and were super nice and helpful with all the questions I asked. They really made ​​me feel right at home, I specially record a guy name Louis for being so sweet and kind. The hotel recently opened so much that everything new, clean, and in excellent condition.
user_name:
Batel M
Tel Aviv, Tel Aviv, Israel

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Stayed here for a couple of days while on business in NYC. Location is great - the best location i've had in NYC!!!! Walking distance to bars, restaurants, subway and Times Square.Hotel was clean and fresh (being almost brand new). Rooms are on the small side but not too small. Beds were great and rooms were well kept. Floor staff very nice and easy going.Breakfast simple but had everything i needed and tasted good. Could be a bit crowded, a larger seating area would be good.West side Manhattan - again! This hotel - also again!!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I recently stayed here with my family for an around the "East Coast" holiday. We checked in on 16th June til 21st June and then rebooked for our return leg from 19th-21st July.The only downside was the slow elevators . The staff are great.They recognised our faces immediately upon our return visit. Right from the moment of check in after a long 24 hour commute from Melbourne Australia they really looked after us. Luis (the manager on duty) accommadated our needs for a larger room. From Alex (the fire warden) to Farrell (the breakfast server) we were looked after and constantly asked " how we were".This hotel is only a 10 minute walk to Time Square and very close to "The Intrepid" aircraft carrier museum. I would recommend to stay here but ask for a room that ends in the number "15" . Thank you Luis , Alex & Farrell for looking after my family and I.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I checked out on the 21st June 2013 and up to today 16th July 2013, I haven't received my $50.00 deposit. I live in Australia and I have rang the front desk twice and on one occasion, I was put on hold for over 10mins. It has also cost me almost half of my deposit to make these calls to the hotel. Hotel staff weren't too bad. Juan was very nice and helpful. Rooms were okay. Elevators were a pain and breakfast was a little hassle. C B

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Overall it was a calm and relaxing place. Serve breakfast in the morning. Not a great location the salvation army is infrot Except the workers their are very rude. Specially Jazmine very rude and demanding.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I am a great believer that, if you express your needs clearly (and ahead of your stay) you are likely to have a great experience. This was the case this past week at our first stay at the NEW Holiday Inn Express on Manhattan's West Side. We will most certainly be back again! The staff here were earnestly and promptly happy to help as our needs evolved throughout our stay. Starting with Richard Bailey, who expertly handled all of our special requests before our arrival, and continuing on with supervisor Farrah Francois, and front desk supervisors Luis and Aniket, the staff truly embodied the phrase "service with a smile." Latch, in engineering, could not be more pleasant when correcting a small problem with our room. All responses to our questions and needs were swift, cheerful, helpful, and professional. Kudos to this great crew! It is often hard to "get things right" when a hotel first opens. The lead staff at this hotel work very hard to do so! For your reference, our trip was part business / part leisure.The rooms, though small, are nicely designed and clean.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I too was nervous about checking in after reading some of the initial reviews. I chalked them up to it being a new hotel and I am glad I did. First and foremost, the staff was exceptional. Everybody (yes, everybody) was not only pleasant, but outright nice AND helpful...sometimes unusual in New York. Second, the location was good, but they can't do anything about that. The street is quiet so you might have to walk to 10th or 11th Aves to get a taxi. The walk to the subway isn't too bad, but the E only goes downtown. Very close to Restaurant Row and certainly walking distance to any of the B'way theaters/Times Sq etc. I booked 2 rooms and arrived at noon. Both rooms were ready for check-in. Very nice. Yes, the rooms are small but comfortable. Comfy beds, nice pillows, great shower. The elevators can be slow especially at check out time. There is also a lot of employee activity on the elevators that takes precious usage away from guests. Unfortunately, there is no service elevator. The stairs are definitely an option and I used them frequently.I took advantage of the location to secure a spot for the 4th fireworks. Left the hotel at 8:10 and walked to the Hudson and had a great spot by 8:20. The fireworks started at 9:30. I saw many people stream down to the river much earlier and I would be hard pressed to say they had a better view than I did. I was right by the USS Intrepid and the fireworks just overhead. No complaints. The room I was in did have a partial view of the fireworks according to my mom who stayed behind to watch from there.Lots of restaurants, delis, nightlife etc all within walking distance. All in all, a great place. Oh, yeah...for now, you might want to avoid if you are one to take afternoon naps. Not sure why you would in NYC, but the construction on 48th St. can be noisy.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This was a nightmare...I am a priority club member and have NEVER been so dissatisfied with a hotel. Before booking, I called to see if July 4 fireworks could be seen from hotel rooms and was assured that some rooms could accommodate that. So, I booked, a room facing the Hudson. Our train was on a lengthy delay so my daughter (who lives in the city) checked in for us to be sure we got the room. We got to the room to discover that not only were we not facing the Hudson but on the opposite end of the hotel. I was told no other rooms available.. In the morning, we went down to breakfast, returning to discover we were "locked out" of our room due to a malfunction. Back to the desk. New keys, back upstairs, keys didn't work. We did this FOUR TIMES, each time having to wait in very lengthy lines to even get to the desk. Finally, a mechanic was sent up to fix the door. Back down for new keys, back up to discover they didn't work. Long story short, we were locked out of our room until 230 pm. When the maid let us is, we discover the room hadn't even been cleaned. At that time, I got yet another set of keys, which didn't work. I called downstairs asking for a manager. Called again at 315 and demanded the manager who finally came up. I continued to be locked out of the room and had to check in at the desk to get into my room. So, I had a room I basically didn't utilize for the day, couldn't shower, missed meeting friends in Times Square. HORRIBLE. I have lost my faith in holiday inn chain.
