The only "compensation", HALF of the points I used will be returned and not a dime that I paid will be refunded. SUCKS!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I booked this hotel before it opened and was a bit worried by the bad reviews I read before going on my holiday.I must say that I was very pleased with the hotel. Yes, the room is small, but it is comfortable (as was the bed which had 2 different kinds of pillows) and well organized, and the bathroom is quite big. I can assure you I have stayed in rooms the same size for double the price in new York. It was also clean and the staff very polite and helpful at all times. The location is excellent for the price. Just a very short walk to times square etc. and we had no problems with the area. We always felt safe, even at night and hardly even noticed the Salvation Army offices.The downsides were really minor; yes the elevator is slow! We did not try the breakfast because the breakfast room was overly crowded when we went there (but there are lots of places nearby to have a real American breakfast). Lastly, the construction site in front of the hotel is a problem if you are waking up after 7.00 a.m. (we weren't due to jet-lag!). In that case ask for a room at the back of the hotel.I just think that at the price we paid it would be impossible to find another hotel in Manhattan with that location, that clean and with pleasing service. Will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: They have worked the Opening Day kinks out! Original reviews cited many problems we didn't encounter. Check in was quick and cordial; they even offered us a loading pass so that we could leave our car on the street temporarily. Parking was about 2 blocks away, easy to find and was $30 per day - very low for New York. The hotel is new, well appointed, with comfy beds, small but adequate rooms, nice bathrooms, safe, fridge and coffee/tea maker. Breakfast was decent and filling but not gourmet. The staff was pleasant, helpful and aimed to please. Wifi code was given at check in and worked. There is also a computer for guest use to check in to flights. Location is good, close enough to Time Square, the restaurants of Hell's Kitchen, Subway and the Hudson River/Intrepid. Easy to get into and out of, close to the Lincoln Tunnel and the Hudson Parkway. Only problem was the elevator service - only two, quite small and often a wait. Choose a low floor so that you can use the stairs if you get the chance. Very little to complain about in this nice midtown reasonably priced hotel.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The staff are very helpful and friendly.The breakfast space is a little bit cramp.The food is not bad and adequate.The surrounding of the hotel is not very pleasant.The room is clean but small.A little far from subway but centrally located in Manhattan.Easy walk to Time Square and Broadway.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: this hotel was really good for us, 10 minutes from Times Square, not expensive for New York . It was very clean and the staff were very helpful, friendly and fun. The breakfast was good, there were 2 computors for free use as well as free wifi. rooms had all we needed including a fridge and coffee maker. I would stay again. Breakfast had, eggs, bacon or sausage, bread, muffins, bagels, cereal , bananas etc, lots of choice. Great food nearby as it is in Hells Kitchen. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Tea and coffee all day and night.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I just want to let trip advisor know that if visiting this location, please look for Richard at the front desk... My family and I were helped so much by him and his service was great, made a lasting impression on our stay overall!As far as the hotel, it's new... So when it was explained to us My wife understood the construction, the elevator thing was horrible but they have great employees like Rich :) The room was NYC size small but clean, service was great in the morning-Jasmine is very helpful as well. We'll be back July 4th looking for Richard and Jasmine :)

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Considering where this hotel is located (across the street from a Salvation Army rehab center) in Hells Kitchen, I was quite pleased. The staff was always available and on top of things if you had a request. There was never a difficulty finding a staff member. It's walkable to a lot of restaurants. The size of the room was just right and it was clean! My only complaint is the water pressure in the shower which is due to the low pressure showerhead. I would stay there again!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: A gem of a hotel!This hotel is located in the Hells Kitchen section of midtown Manhattan, near the Theater District. In June 2013, it was a completed building, occupying the space of a former very old apartment building, on a predominantly residential street. It is two blocks east of the Hudson River. (Remember Captain Chesley B. “Sully” Sullenberger’s remarkable landing in the river?) Discovered it, quite by accident, in an online search. It is beautifully constructed to fit the existing décor of the area. I have stayed in many Holiday Inn Express’s throughout our great country. This one is definitely the best! From the very first contact, the staff were unbelievably friendly, helpful and cordial. The rooms were designed by an architect who knew a lot about organization and valuable space saving. The room layout is small but very easy to live in. More than usual recepticles. Cleanliness of the room & common areas was impeccable. I was on the 10th floor of eleven, on the south side of the building, with a great view of the local city skyline. I have NEVER seen stairwells, all eleven floors, so clean! I am a frequent user of stairwells, especially at this hotel! Quiet stairwell exit doors. The prices of the rooms are reasonable for NYC, but expensive for me. I received a “senior” discount which reduced the price of the room substantially.The negatives were livable: VERY slow elevators (2) & a breakfast not suitable for healthy eating, but passable. There are plenty of good places to eat within a four block radius of the hotel.I would definitely recommend this hotel as a NYC place to stay. It’s location from the nearest subway station is four blocks to the blue line train at 50th street, but an easy walk. In my opinion, the best way to get around NYC is by subway. Depending on the length of stay, the best dollar deal is to purchase the 7 day unlimited Metro Pass for $30. A regular priced subway is $2.50 for EACH ride, no matter how long or short the ride. The Metro Pass allows unlimited rides during a seven day period, and the seven day period begins with your first ride.No laundry facility onsite, but there is a “wash & fold” laundromat less than a block away. I did not use the exercise room, but it looked well equipped.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: the room is too small or should i say tiny. the breakfast did not have anything except for breads and juices. No bell staff or any thing other services available in the hotel.Wifi is free that is the only plus point.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My wife and stayed here on a 5 day vacation to NYC. The hotel is new so it is in very nice. The location is about 4 blocks from time square. The size of the room was adequate as well. The problem with most hotels is it's housekeeping and this hotel is no exception. Upon getting my room key, we discovered that the room had not been prepared. The bed was unmade and housekeeping was just like "ummmmmmm, I dunno" The lady at the desk was very apologetic and put us in another room. Everything was fine until the next day after we got in about 11:00 pm and discovered that housekeeping didn't replenish ANY towels. We had to call the front desk to get towels. This was a true inconvenience since we were dog tired when we made it back to the room. A maintenance man brought us about 20 towels, unfortunately they were all bath towels. I left the remaining pile of towels on the floor the next day hoping that housekeeping would give us the correct quantities of towels, both large and small. NOPE, the pile of towels were still on the floor and the trash can was not even emptied. Not only that our soap was never replaced by housekeeping. I had to go down stairs and get a bar. I understand that they were just opening up a few days before my arrival, but the housekeeping situation was just unacceptable. I hope they have gotten these issues resolved as this is a nice hidden gem. I would be willing to stay here again, but would quickly choose another hotel if the same housekeeping issues remain. To the hotel management, my service and cleanliness score is strictly based on the housekeeping and not on services provided by the front desk or maintenance staff.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We arrived and needed help accommodating last minute guests/friends. Luis and Juan were very friendly and helped us out immediately. Excellent customer service! The location is slightly out of the way but $30 will get you a cab all the way across town. $30 overnight parking was also very nice and easy to figureout

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: The room i had was really tiny, like it was difficult to go to the bathroom, but for the price, in Mahnattan, if you just want to store your luggage in a secure place and if you just want to sleep there, and you spênt the whole day outside, that's perfect i think,

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I have to say after reading some reviews I didn't know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised check in was quick and the clerk (Juan) was very friendly. All the staff I met were really nice and were very interested in great customer service. Hotel is brand new and they are still working on the outside. I didn't find it a issue and it was during the day when most people are out. The only issue I had was slow elevators and if that's the worse thing to say about a hotel I think it's pretty good. Rooms were small but price was right for a hotel in manhattan especially one that gives breakfast. Which is normal Holiday Inn express with the yummy cinnamon buns! Breakfast was crowded in the am's but they were refilling as need. I didn't find the Salvation Army location across the street a issue at all. I didn't see any one hanging around at night. This hotel is in a residential neighbor and is quiet at night. I would stay again in this location with out hesitation!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We found the staff at the hotel super friendly and helpful. This was across the board, from the two guys at the front desk (Juan and Luis) to all of the housekeeping staff to the eating area staff, who in the midst of a chaotic breakfast did not mind replenishing different things that they had run out of... i would recommend getting a room away from the construction on 48th street (the construction started at 7am and was really loud) but after one night, we asked to have our room moved, and they were more than glad to do so. once we moved to the other side of the hotel, it was no problem. My only minor complaint about the hotel was the elevator, which was super slow at times when a lot of people were using it. We very much enjoyed our stay!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: This is a brand new hotel that just opened a couple of months ago and is quite a good option for budget travelers.It's location is still quite close to the heart of things. On W 48th and 10th, the hotel is perhaps a 10 min walk from Columbus Circle/Central Park and equally as far from Times Square. The staff was so helpful to the point of flattery. I think they were trying to make a good impression for their new venture. (Note: good impression made)The rooms are basic but well equipped, coming not only with a mini fridge but also a coffeee maker.As with all Holiday Inn Expresses, breakfast is free, but it is, again, par quality. There are eggs, pancackes, sausages, bacon, etc, but the food is all super processed supermarket food--what you would expect from NY.There is also a nice gym that is small but doesn't seem to be used much.Overall, I suggest this place for the budget traveler who wants quality, a good price and a close location to the city.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I do not understand what expectations other people have? I mean, this is a hotel in manhattan with included breakfast for a very good price. This is our second day here of six and must say its been much better than people say. The staff at the front desk are so friendly. Especially Juan and Scott who took good care of us when we arrived. The breakfast is not top class, but its good. The rooms are a bit small, but clean and fresh! About the elevators.. Take the stairs if you are in a rush.. And whoever was complaining about scary and dirty drug addicts hanging around outside the hotel.. It is not true. What I've seen is staff at the salvation army standing outside their front door talking to each other. The location is good, 5 minutes walk from Times Square. If you want better, pay more.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: We knew our flight arrived early in the morning, so we e-mailed the hotel a few days beforehand to request either an early check-in, or at least a confirmation that we could drop our luggage off once we arrived in the city. Unfortunately, the hotel did not respond. We did end up going to the hotel at around 9am, and were fortunate enough to find out our room was already prepared for us. The hotel room was small, with the king sized bed taking up almost all of the room, but that was fine. The bathroom was a 3 piece with just a stand up shower. The shower was a bit too small, however. My girlfriend when showering hit the tap with her elbow which switched the water to hot which burned her. The hotel staff was all very polite and helpful, however the housekeeping staff was a bit aggressive trying to clean the room the morning we were checking out. We wanted to have a relaxing morning and had the "do not disturb" sign on our door. Check out time was 11, but by 10:45 when we left our door was already knocked on 3 times to be cleaned. The hallways were also loud in the morning when other guests were leaving and yelling to each other from the hallway to their rooms. We found the location to be a bit far from the subway. It's about a 15 minute walk to one.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Where to begin? In 20 years of travel I have NEVER been this disappointed and this is the first time that I have ever posted a review because I was so disappointing with the hotel experience. You arrive to a hotel that has a Salvation Army with homeless people loitering around the front, the photo the hotel has put up on Trip Advisor are 3D model interpretations of the place - the front looks nothing like what is shown and trust me, you wouldn't want to hang out there even if they had the nice looking outdoor area. Staff in the hotel have attitude and are not helpful. While there was a couple of them who actually appreciated guest (none at front desk) most of the staff have a real attitude and seem to hate having customers there. My favorite part was the act they put on when management is around only to turn back to their usual selves as soon as they disappeared. The room was spacious but that's about where it ends. It was poorly finished and was obviously rushed, the TV didn't work and needed a technician to come and fix it. The carpets are already dirty and overall disappointing for a hotel that just opened. Images of rooms on this site are 3D models - so don't bother with them and wait for someone to upload some pictures. While the air conditioning was noisy it was a pleasant occasional relief from the noise in this hotel. Doors bang VERY loud every time someone opens them, street noises are MUCH louder than other parts of New York and basically I didn't get any sleep while there. Breakfast was like a pig farm where the animals are let to the trough. Food was always finished, poorly organized, short staffed and requests by guests to staff for more food were ignored along with accompanying eye rolls. Guests were clambering over each other to get a extra slice of bread. House keeping is generally terrible as well - rooms have to be requested to be cleaned and even that sometimes doesn't guarantee that the room is made!Management PLEASE MYSTERY STAY this hotel if you want to stay open!! Check in various people of different ethnicity and you'll realize what a problem you have! While I sometimes have average stays this one actually made me angry enough to write this review. Don't waste your money, you will hate your trip if you stay here.

Desert Hot Springs, California

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: First off, This Hotel is Not Organized at all... Absolutely Awful.. I booked 3 rooms here for a weekend get away for the Family and I. Check in is 3pm. My Sister arrives at 3:30 and waits to check in. I arrive at 4pm and still she was waiting in line.THE FRONT DESK WAS SOO SLOW AND SO NOT ORGANIZED.. EVERYONE HAD PROBLEMS CHECKING IN AND OUT!!! When I finally reach the counter, they inform me that the rooms are not ready. I had requested 3 doubles and close together because we have our teens with us. They then tell me that they can give me one room for now and the other rooms will be ready shortly. Frustrated now, I agreed and 11 of us went to a very small double room. Hey it's NYC the rooms run small.. okay.. Feeling cramped I took the kids around the city. An hour later I called the front desk because I have not received a call from them which they stated they would do..Yet the rooms were still not ready. I went back to the hotel and they gave us another double on a totally different floor...Then for the last room they stated the only one available now is a king bed room..Again on a totally different floor.. I no longer wanted to wait so I took it.. THE ROOMS are all new, very small though, One of the rooms the tv didn't work, The other room the toilet didn't flush, so had to move to a different room on a different floor.. THE ELEVATOR was extremely slow so we used the stairs. THE LOBBY BATHROOM required a key card to get in to and was a hotel room unfinished, and dirty.. Breakfast was Awful.. Completely packed and they Ran out of everything. AND NO CINNAMON ROLLS..I have stayed at 20 different Holiday Inns and they are Famous for these rolls.. THIS HOTEL IS LOCATED DIRECTLY ACROSS A DRUG REHAB.. VERY SCARY. ALOT OF MEN standing out front staring at you going in and out.. I give it a 2 stars for location though.. Couple blocks from the pier and Time Square.. ALL IN ALL A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE WITH THIS HOLIDAY INN.. IT DOES NOT LIVE UP TO THE HOLIDAY INN STANDARDS.. I AM VERY DISAPPOINTED AND WILL RECONSIDER STAYING AT THE HOLIDAY INN CHAINS..

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Hotel new it had just opened a few days prior. Front desk was very nice and eager to assist with our needs. Rooms very attractive with a refrigerator and the views from the 14 line high floor were very nice. Very busy hotel in breakfast was packed but they had everything in order eggs and bacon. First time i had stayed in a holiday Inn Express and enjoyed it.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: I cannot comment on the hotel stay because I only have a reservation, but I can tell you that the customer service is horrible! I booked a room at this hotel online May 9th with a friends and family rate. After I looked at the price, I hit submit and a confirmation page came up saying I had the advance purchase rate which was $200 higher than the rate I had just seen on the page! I called the holiday inn 800 number immediately as the hotel had not yet opened and they said someone would contact me within 48 hours (which they didn't). When I called back a few days later I was basically called a liar and they said I chose the advance purchase rate. I told them I did not, and they told me it was up to the manager of the hotel and she was the only one who could modify the rate and it was at her discretion and they would have her call me within 48 hours (which she did not). Never did get to talk to the manager due to them transferring me elsewhere or they said she was not there...Long story short, Ive called the hotel and holiday inn's main number and they kept transferring me and putting me on hold and I have spent over two hours combined on the phone for nothing. They won't fix my rate because they claim it wasn't their fault. It is non-refundable and cannot be cancelled according to them. I do not want a refund or to cancel I just wanted the rate I chose! They say they have a screenshot showing the advance purchase rate, who cares! So do I because that is what came up when I hit submit but that is not what it said BEFORE I hit submit!! So aggravated! I will update on the actual hotel itself in a few weeks, but this is the LAST time I will stay here!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: Wherer to start: The room was not ready until nearly 8 pm on night of checkin making us late for our dinner reservations. They ran out of all breakfast components on both mornings. I asked them why they weren't prepared for the next day when they ran out the day before and the repsonse was, "We don't get deliveries on weekends". I guess there are no stores in NYC, I walked less than a block to a Bodega and they had plenty of eggs and bacon and cereal. They didn't clean our room on day #2, I ran into the housekeeping manager and asked for towels, he brought us four bathmats. I explained this all at checkout and they said they were going to comp our stay, this has yet to happen and it was six days ago, "they did said give us a couple hours" they didn't say which hours and on what day. On an upnote the rooms are nice and comfy.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: My husband and i came only days after opening.....hoping to spend a romantic week in New York... Here is how our stay began...Check in was quick and painless. LOCATION - Across the road from the Salvation Army with dirty people handing out the front day and night. It feels unsafe and horrible.SAFETY DEPOSIT BOX - Our travel requirement in each hotel is a safety deposit box and we always confirm this before booking. When i asked the young girl where their safety deposit box she looked at me blankly and "Are you checking out?" 'Um, no, we need a safety deposit box'. She replied "Im not sure what it is". She went to ask the manager. We were informed they didnt have any. Why advertise it then?? RAN OUT OF FOOD - Breakfast is included in the room rate. When i came down for breakfast there were a lot of unhappy customers as the food had run out only 1hr into breakfast. Not even a slice of toast. My husband and i had a lemon tea. At least they had cups and tea bags. When i asked the staff if there was anymore food they just walked off. How can you run out of food when you promise breakfast??HOUSEKEEPING - Housekeeping from 9-5pm. We were out of the room from 11am - 3pm. When i got back hoping to have a nap as i was tired from walking in the sun all day i called reception asking if housekeeping was going to come before they finished for the day. They said someone would be at the room right away. 45 minutes later i called reception again. THey said they would send someone right away. After 20 more minutes reception was nice enough to call me to ask if the cleaner had come yet, and i told her we were still waiting. The cleaner was really apologetic when she came and she worked quickly so we could get back into our room which was sweet of her. SECURITY - Bring your valuable with you. All the cleaners wear uniforms, but we noticed one was in casual clothes helping a cleaner in uniform on another floor. WTF!! i dont want ANYONE besides the cleaner in my room at ANY time. What kind of security is this??CUSTOMER SERVICE - The staff have attitude towards customer queries or complaints. Both experienced and observed towards other customers. DIRTY - The hotel hallway was disgusting for days, it looked like it hadnt been vaccuumed in a week. It was so gross. I have attached photos. There was a box of rubbish left in the hallway next to a door to an empty unfurnished concrete room. The door to the unfurnished concrete room was left open blowing dirt, dust and debris into the hallway. UNPROFESSIONAL - Unprofessional, unscripted emergency testing announcements. NOISY - Noisy people in the hallway and people yelling and smashing things in the street. BAD FINISHES - BUDGET hotel roughly finished. THe shower floor had brown patches, the grout was messy and the wallpaper was sliced with a stanley knife near the light switch.Positive attributes - The a/c is very efficient, the room is comfortable and brand new but the bathroom is very tight. This hotel was full of Asians, Indians & Muslims.DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!!!!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Manhattan Midtown West
review_body: GreaT hotel, really clean and neat! The room was excellent, very fast wifi, the shower was awesome, lots of space and a great greeting enviorement.Free Breakfast had everythin, pancakes, eggs, waffles, muffins, cereal, juices, all delicious.Thanks for the king bed!!
